0.title: It exposed inefficiency, recklessness of NCB: RGV on Aryan's clean chit
0.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to react to Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan getting a clean chit by NCB in the Mumbai cruise drugs case. He wrote, "The...good thing which came about...is him being a celebrity's son. It helped in...exposing the inefficiency and recklessness of...agencies subjecting innocent people to harassment which otherwise...people can't and won't know of."

1.title: This is for Sri Lankans: Karunarathna on SL's 1-0 Test series win vs B'desh
1.article_body: Following Sri Lanka's 1-0 Test series win against Bangladesh, Sri Lanka skipper Dimuth Karunarathna took to Twitter and wrote, "I would like to dedicate the win to all Sri Lankans." He added, "We are having a tough time there. This win brings some joy to their faces." Notably, Sri Lanka is currently experiencing its worst economic crisis in history.

2.title: Venkatesh told me last season, 'Patidar is a brilliant player': Harbhajan
2.article_body: Talking about Rajat Patidar, Harbhajan Singh said Venkatesh Iyer had told him about the RCB batter during IPL 2021. "He told me, 'He's a brilliant player...can single-handedly win the match for his team'...that innings[112*], against LSG, showed that the player has a lot of capability," he added. Patidar was picked as a replacement for injured Luvnith Sisodia in IPL 2022.

3.title: AAP's free electricity offer troubling Gujarat BJP chief: Kejriwal
3.article_body: AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday took to Twitter and asked why his offer to provide free electricity to the people of Gujarat was "troubling" state BJP chief CR Patil. "There is huge corruption in Gujarat government," Kejriwal added. His remarks come after Patil recently cautioned people against getting influenced by freebies offered by "some political leaders".

4.title: IAS officer wades through mud to inspect flood-hit areas in Assam, pics go viral
4.article_body: Pictures of an IAS officer visiting flood-affected areas in Assam's Cachar have gone viral on Twitter, with many users and civil servants praising her efforts. Cachar district's Deputy Commissioner Keerthi Jalli is seen wading through mud to interact with locals to understand their problems. Locals reportedly said this was the first time a Deputy Commissioner visited them.

5.title: NHRC notice to Maha as 4 kids test HIV +ve after blood transfusion
5.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has taken suo motu cognisance of a media report which stated that four thalassemic children tested HIV positive in Maharashtra's Nagpur allegedly after blood transfusions and one of them died. The NHRC has issued a notice to the state Chief Secretary, calling for a detailed report in the matter within six weeks.

6.title: Nykaa's Q4 net profit falls 49% to ₹8.56 crore, revenue rises to ₹973 crore
6.article_body: Beauty e-commerce startup Nykaa's parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures Ltd reported that the net profit attributable to its shareholders dropped 49% year-on-year to ₹8.56 crore in the quarter ended March. While the company's revenue from operations rose 31% year-on-year to ₹973 crore, its expenses rose to about ₹979 crore from ₹725 crore a year earlier.

7.title: 'Prithviraj' renamed to 'Samrat Prithviraj' over Karni Sena's demand
7.article_body: The makers of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj' have renamed the film to 'Samrat Prithviraj' following the demand from Karni Sena. A letter penned by YRF CEO addressed to Karni Sena's National, Youth and State Presidents has surfaced. It reads, "We are highly appreciative of the mutual agreement reached between us that you have no further objections with regards to our Film."

8.title: Anguished: PM Modi on death of 7 soldiers in Ladakh accident
8.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed his condolences over the death of seven Indian Army soldiers in a road accident in Ladakh. PM said he's anguished by the loss of the army personnel, adding, "My thoughts are with...bereaved families." The accident occurred in Ladakh's Turtuk village when the vehicle in which the soldiers were travelling fell into the Shyok river, reports said.

9.title: No monkeypox cases in India yet, no need to panic: ICMR scientist
9.article_body: A scientist of the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) advised people not to panic over monkeypox, adding, "In India, we haven't had any case yet." "We are having cases in non-endemic countries of Europe and the USA," ICMR scientist Dr Aparna Mukherjee said. The government is keeping a watch, she added.

10.title: Ex-Tripura MLA Ashish Das quits TMC, says 'can't survive in TMC'
10.article_body: Former Tripura MLA Ashish Das on Friday quit the Trinamool Congress (TMC), stating that "it's no longer possible for him to survive in the party". He said that the TMC leadership "doesn't give due respect" to its leaders, adding, "They (party leadership) don't even consider us human beings." Das had quit the BJP to join the TMC in October 2021.

11.title: J&K's situation deteriorating: Mufti after meeting Amreen's family
11.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti met the family members of TV artiste Amreen Bhat, who was killed by terrorists in Budgam and said "situation is deteriorating" in the valley. "Innocent people are being killed every day," Mufti said. Criticising the Centre, she said, "Government keeps blowing its trumpet of normalcy in Jammu and Kashmir even when such gruesome incidents suggest otherwise."

12.title: 1st transgender Barbie designed after actress Laverne Cox, pic released
12.article_body: Laverne Cox has made history by becoming Mattel's first-ever transgender Barbie. The actress and LGBTQ rights-advocate got this recognition just a few days before her 50th birthday later this week. The company described Cox as "a four-time Emmy-nominated actress, Emmy-winning producer, and the first transgender woman of colour to have a leading role on a scripted TV show".

13.title: Argentina reports Latin America's 1st confirmed monkeypox case: AP
13.article_body: Argentina on Friday reported Latin America's first confirmed case of monkeypox in a resident of Buenos Aires province, according to The Associated Press. The man had travelled to Spain recently, according to authorities. Notably, nearly 200 cases of monkeypox have been reported in more than 20 countries so far, the World Health Organization (WHO) said.

14.title: 'Was filmed without consent by coach's trainee', says gymnast Reddy; probe launched
14.article_body: Gymnast Aruna Budda Reddy has alleged that she was videographed without her consent during a physical fitness test in March, by a trainee of coach Rohit Jaiswal. The Sports Authority of India (SAI) has formed a three-member inquiry committee to look into the allegations. Reddy had threatened legal action after Jaiswal got a clean chit from Gymnastics Federation of India.

15.title: Deeply saddened: Rajnath on death of 7 soldiers in Ladakh accident
15.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said he was "deeply saddened" by the loss of lives of seven Indian Army soldiers due to an accident in Ladakh's Turtuk village. "We will never forget their exemplary service to our nation," he added. "My condolences to the bereaved families and prayers for the speedy recovery of the injured," the minister further said.

16.title: Dismissed Punjab Health Minister sent to 14-day judicial custody
16.article_body: A Mohali court has sent former Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla to 14-day judicial custody till June 10. Vijay was arrested by the Anti-Corruption Branch after Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann dismissed him from the state Cabinet over alleged corruption charges. Singla was allegedly demanding a 1% commission from officials for contracts, CM Mann's office had said.

17.title: I feel like my baby was taken away from me: Bose on being fired as Zilingo CEO
17.article_body: Ankiti Bose, the Co-founder of Singapore-based Zilingo who was fired as CEO last week, said, "I feel like my baby has been taken away from me without giving me a proper explanation or a chance to fight for her back." Bose told Bloomberg she's "grieving and fighting" for herself simultaneously. Bose, who was fired for "serious financial irregularities", denied wrongdoing.

18.title: 4 killed, 7 injured as auto-rickshaw overturns in Andhra's Krishna
18.article_body: Police said that four people were killed and seven others were injured when the auto-rickshaw they were travelling in overturned while trying to overtake another vehicle in Andhra Pradesh's Krishna district. Avanigadda DSP Mahaboob Basha said that 20 people were travelling in the auto-rickshaw at the time of the accident. Three women and a man died on the spot.

19.title: Boney Kapoor's credit card fraudulently used for transactions worth ₹3.82 lakh
19.article_body: An aide of producer Boney Kapoor has filed a complaint against an unidentified person after the latter's credit card was fraudulently used to carry out transactions totalling ₹3.82 lakh. The accused has used the credit card to carry out five online transactions. Kapoor found out about it when an executive from his bank called up for credit card bill payment.

20.title: Things are falling in place for RCB: Manjrekar ahead of Qualifier 2
20.article_body: On being asked why he predicted RCB would win Qualifier 2 against RR in IPL 2022, Sanjay Manjrekar said things are falling in place for Faf du Plessis-led side. "They have class bowlers, they performed well in the last match where Mohammed Siraj took a crucial wicket," he added. Manjrekar further said that Harshal Patel is the team's trump card.

21.title: Delhi approves ₹16 crore-project for strengthening 12 city roads
21.article_body: The Delhi government has approved a project worth ₹16.03 crore for strengthening 12 key roads in the capital, including the stretch in front of the Akshardham Temple that connects Delhi with Noida. Public Works Department (PWD) officials said these 12 stretches will be overhauled in a way that the area is also decongested. Potholes will also be filled, officials added.

22.title: ED attaches Pune firm's assets worth ₹62.7 cr in bank fraud case
22.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has issued an order to attach assets worth ₹62.7 crore belonging to a Pune-based firm over its alleged involvement in a bank fraud case. The investigation was launched in 2020 after the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB), Pune wing registered an FIR. The fraud was committed at the Andhra Bank.

23.title: RR to bowl first against RCB in IPL 2022 Qualifier 2, playing XIs announced
23.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) captain Sanju Samson won the toss and elected to bowl first against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) in the Qualifier 2 at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Friday. Both the teams are fielding an unchanged side. The winner of the Qualifier 2 will face Gujarat Titans (GT) in the final on Sunday.

24.title: Pune civic body's Fire Dept received 482 calls in April and May
24.article_body: The Fire Department of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has received 482 calls in April and May this year. "The main reason for the rise in the number of incidents of fire in the city is the rise in temperature," the department's Assistant Divisional Officer said. Last year, the department reported 313 cases in April and May.

25.title: I've a gut feeling RCB will go all the way: Harbhajan ahead of RCB-RR
25.article_body: Ahead of Qualifier 2 between RCB and RR in IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh said, "I've a gut feeling that RCB will go all the way this season. And if they do, they'll probably lift the cup." He added that current RCB team has very good players, who can win the trophy for them. Match will be played in Ahmedabad today.

26.title: Brand accused of copying artwork used in Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's Cannes outfit
26.article_body: A Kolkata-based brand Bobo Calcutta has been accused of plagiarising the artwork that was embroidered on a jacket worn by Aishwarya Rai Bachchan at Cannes this year. Bengaluru-based artist Nidhi Jacob has accused the ready-to-wear label of copying her artwork without paying her. She also noted that the brand even copied her choice of colours.

27.title: Sri Lanka beat Bangladesh by 10 wickets in 2nd Test, win series 1-0
27.article_body: Sri Lanka beat hosts Bangladesh by 10 wickets in second Test in Dhaka on Friday to win the two match series 1-0. After Sri Lanka took a first-innings lead of 141, they bowled out Bangladesh for 169 in their second innings. The visitors chased the 29-run target in three overs. Fast bowler Asitha Fernando took 10 wickets in the match.

28.title: We've decided to work together: Kejriwal on meeting Delhi's new LG
28.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday met the newly-appointed Lieutenant Governor of Delhi Vinai Kumar Saxena. Informing about the same, Kejriwal said, "We discussed several issues and decided to work together for...betterment of...[Delhi's people]." Saxena, who took oath as the 22nd Lt Governor of Delhi on Thursday, had said that he'll work as a "local guardian" in the national capital.

29.title: Indian peacekeepers thwart attack by rebel group in DR Congo
29.article_body: UN peacekeepers from India and other nations have thwarted an attack by a rebel group in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), a senior UN official said. The M23 group has been active in the last couple of weeks in eastern DRC, the official added. The UN is following the situation very closely, the official further said.

30.title: 9-year-old girl dies as houseboat catches fire in J&K's Dal Lake
30.article_body: A nine-year-old girl was charred to death after a houseboat in Dal Lake in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar caught fire on Friday, officials said. According to officials, fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the fire soon after getting information. An investigation is underway to determine the exact cause of the fire.

31.title: Man arrested for selling narcotics in B'luru, 90 grams MDMA seized
31.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have arrested a person who was allegedly involved in the sale of narcotics, the city's Deputy Commissioner of Police (West Division) Sanjeev M Patil said. Police have recovered 90 grams MDMA, 33 grams brown sugar, 300 grams opium and a two-wheeler from his possession, he added. Patil has also shared a picture of the seized items.

32.title: I'd be lucky: Samantha to troll who said she will die alone
32.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu has responded to a social media user who trolled her by writing in a now-deleted tweet, "She's gonna end up dying alone with cats and dogs." The actress replied, "I would consider myself lucky." Samantha had announced her split from husband actor Naga Chaitanya in October 2021 ahead of their fourth wedding anniversary.

33.title: Ex-Maha minister Deshmukh complains of chest pain, admitted to ICU
33.article_body: Former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh has been admitted to ICU at Mumbai's KEM Hospital on Friday after he complained of chest pain, high blood pressure and shoulder pain. According to officials, Deshmukh will undergo a stress test shortly. As per an official statement released by the hospital, his condition is being monitored closely.

34.title: So damn uncool to fat shame: Malaika on Amrita getting trolled
34.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora has shared her sister Amrita Arora's Instagram story on receiving "hate" over her weight gain. Malaika wrote, "You say it sis... [You're] beautiful [just] the way you are... [And] guys it's so damn uncool to fat shame anyone... Tch Tch." Amrita also reacted to trolls calling her "old", writing, "So buddhi is meant to be an insult??"

35.title: Ex-Twitter India head steps down as CEO of his edtech startup Invact Metaversity
35.article_body: Invact Metaversity on Friday said its Co-founder Manish Maheshwari is stepping down as CEO and Director. Former Twitter India head Maheshwari and Co-founder Tanay Pratap "had diverging visions" for the edtech startup's long-term prospects, Invact said. "It's heartbreaking for a founder to leave the startup, like a mother leaving her baby. I'm going through the same emotion," Maheshwari tweeted.

36.title: 16th seeds Bopanna-Middelkoop enter French Open pre-quarterfinals
36.article_body: India's Rohan Bopanna and his Dutch partner Matwe Middelkoop entered the men's doubles pre-quarterfinals at French Open. They defeated Andrey Golubev and Fabrice Martin 6-3, 6-4 in second round on Thursday. The Indo-Dutch duo, seeded 16th, will now face second seeds Nikola Mektic and Mate Pavic. Meanwhile, Indo-American pair of Ramkumar Ramanathan and Hunter Reese lost in the second round.

37.title: Dunzo Daily disrupts the grocery delivery market: Dunzo
37.article_body: Freshness is the need of the hour, and Dunzo Daily is delivering the freshest fruits, vegetables, dairy, meat, and daily provisions to your doorstep in 19 min with up to 50% off and free home delivery, Dunzo announced. Choose from a wide range of top quality products and groceries the smart way with Dunzo Daily, they added.

38.title: Share of ₹2,000 notes in circulation falls as RBI prints no new notes for 3rd year
38.article_body: The share of India's highest denomination currency note in circulation is continuing to drop as the RBI has not printed any new ₹2,000 note since 2019-20, according to the central bank's annual report for 2021-22. As of March 31, there were 214 crore notes of ₹2,000 denomination in circulation, compared with 245 crore notes a year ago, the report showed.

39.title: 4 suspects arrested in Tamil Nadu BJP functionary's murder case
39.article_body: The Greater Chennai Police has arrested four people in connection with the murder of 33-year-old Tamil Nadu BJP SC Wing's District Secretary (Chennai Central) Balachander in Chintadripet. The deceased had seven criminal cases, including two related to attempt to murder, against him. He was provided with an armed guard by police after he complained of threat to his life.

40.title: Is 'buddhi' meant to be an insult: Amrita Arora on being age-shamed over latest pic
40.article_body: Actress Amrita Arora has reacted to social media users, who body-shamed her and called her "old" in the comments section of her latest post. Amrita wrote, "So buddhi is meant to be an insult??...For me it's just a word...that means old?" "Also got...lot of hate on my weight gain! I own it...I love it...my weight my problem!" she added.

41.title: 50% dip in kidney transplants after Ruby Hall case: Pune doctors
41.article_body: Pune city doctors have said that there has been at least a 50% decline in the number of live kidney transplants in the city. This comes after a case related to alleged malpractices in a kidney transplant procedure at Ruby Hall Clinic was reported in Pune. So far, police have arrested two persons in connection with the kidney transplant case.

42.title: Certain types of films don't define your place in industry anymore: Yami
42.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, in a recent interview, said the industry is now heading in a positive direction. There isn't that notion anymore that certain types of films will define an actor's place in the industry, Yami said, adding that the audience is extremely welcoming. "Even the industry is now opening up to the idea that everybody can co-exist," she added.

43.title: Didn't have any daily soap to do: Rubina Dilaik on doing 'Khatron...'
43.article_body: TV actress Rubina Dilaik said she is doing 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12' as she didn't have any daily soap to do at present. Further, while talking about her show 'Shakti', she added that she would always prefer quality over quantity. "Weather I...sit at home or wait, I'll only pick...projects that I can contribute to with my full heart," Rubina said.

44.title: I only did 'Kaabil' because it starred Hrithik Roshan: Yami Gautam
44.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has stated that she had been told to "work with only certain names", adding she did Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Kaabil' because of this advice. The actress added that she did it but it didn't work for her. Yami further said that she had a very good role in the film but people said she had "very less role".

45.title: One of those innings that'll last a long time: Faf on Patidar's 112*(54)
45.article_body: Praising Rajat Patidar for his unbeaten 112 off 54 balls in Eliminator against LSG in IPL 2022,  RCB captain Faf du Plessis said his teammate's innings was remarkable. "Just one of those innings that will last a very long time. We were all just in awe watching him," he added. RCB defeated LSG by 14 runs at Eden Gardens.

46.title: Terminally-ill British man gets ‘world’s first’ double hand transplant
46.article_body: Steven Gallagher (48) from Scotland, who suffers from scleroderma, an autoimmune disease that causes scarring of skin and internal organs, got a double hand transplant. The 12-hour operation took place in December 2021 after a suitable donor was found. According to hospital, it's first time in the world that hands of a person terminally affected by scleroderma have been replaced.

47.title: Hyderabad man jailed for 5 days for stalking, harassing woman
47.article_body: A local court in Hyderabad sentenced a 36-year-old man, J Nagesh, to five days imprisonment for stalking and harassing a woman. Police said Nagesh initially catcalled the woman and then started harassing her in the guise of introducing her to weight reduction techniques. Following her complaint, the She Team and the local police identified Nagesh using his bike registration number.

48.title: RBI includes 'work from anywhere' policy for staff in its agenda for 2022-23
48.article_body: The RBI in its annual report that was released on Friday stated "working from anywhere" under its agenda for 2022-2023. While it had operationalised work from home during COVID-19, the annual report further stated, "The roadmap for the year would include…To devise a policy on 'working from anywhere' for building a seamless work environment as part of business continuity planning."

49.title: Yoga Utsav held in Hyd to mark 25-day countdown to Int'l Yoga Day
49.article_body: Over 10,000 people in Hyderabad joined the Yoga Utsav to mark the 25-day countdown to International Yoga Day. The event was organised by the Ministry of Ayush with the support of the Telangana government. The event was held under the theme 'Make Yoga a part of your life', and many politicians and celebrities attended the event.

50.title: Some edtech startups weren't mature: Screwvala on recent layoffs
50.article_body: Ronnie Screwvala, upGrad Chairperson, in an interview discussing funding winter in the startup ecosystem and the recent layoffs by some edtech startups, said one or two firms in the edtech space didn't have the maturity to anticipate challenges. His statements follow the recent layoffs by Vedantu and Unacademy. "Startups, VCs were in La La Land," Screwvala added.

51.title: 52 kgs of cocaine worth ₹500 crore seized at Gujarat's Mundra Port
51.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has seized 52 kilograms of cocaine worth around ₹500 crore, hidden in a consignment of salt shipped from Iran, at Mundra Port in Gujarat's Kutch. After a three-day-long investigation under 'Operation Namkeen', some of the 1,000 bags officials examined were found to be suspicious, as a substance having distinct smell was found in them.

52.title: KL Rahul's 6-hitting ability is more than Kieron Pollard: Harbhajan
52.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Harbhajan Singh said LSG captain KL Rahul often plays the role of an anchor, but his 'six-hitting' ability is more than MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard. Discussing LSG's loss against RCB by 14 runs in IPL 2022's Eliminator, Harbhajan stated, "Lucknow played [slowly] in the initial six overs...[and] missed a trick by not scoring more runs in the powerplay."

53.title: Aim is to take wicket when team needs me: Arshdeep on T20Is vs SA
53.article_body: PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh, who was selected in India's 18-member squad for five-match T20I series against South Africa, said his aim is to take a wicket whenever the team needs him in series. "Waiting for my debut," he added. Arshdeep's death-overs economy rate of 7.58 is only behind Jasprit Bumrah(7.38) for bowlers with at least eight overs in IPL 2022.

54.title: Taliban dismiss UNSC's call to reverse restrictions on Afghan women
54.article_body: The Taliban has rejected the UN Security Council's call to reverse "practices which are currently restricting the human rights and fundamental freedoms of Afghan women and girls". The Security Council's concerns are "unfounded", the Taliban government said. Earlier this month, the Taliban ordered women to cover their faces in public and asked them not to leave their homes unless necessary.

55.title: Wimbledon to drop titles 'Miss', 'Mrs' on its honours board: Report
55.article_body: Wimbledon has reportedly decided to drop the titles "Miss" and "Mrs" before the names of the female players on its honours board. The move has been aimed in an attempt to modernise the tournament. Notably, no titles are used against the names of the male players on the All England Lawn Tennis Club's honours board.

56.title: Sanjay Raut declares assets worth ₹21.14 crore ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
56.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut declared assets worth ₹21.14 crore while filing his nomination for the Rajya Sabha polls. Raut has ₹1,55,872 in cash and ₹1,93,55,809 as bank deposits, his election affidavit stated. He further owns one vehicle purchased in 2004, two revolvers and three parcels of agricultural land in Alibaug. Also, Raut's wife owns a 0.73-acre plot in Palghar.

57.title: MBBS degree holder cheated of ₹52 lakh in Gurugram; 5 booked
57.article_body: A Gurugram-based MBBS degree holder was allegedly cheated of ₹52 lakh on the pretext of getting a seat in a PG course, police said. The accused had reportedly promised him that they would help him in getting the seat under the management quota at a private medical college in West Bengal. Meanwhile, police have booked five people in the case.

58.title: Do not exaggerate Chinese threat: Beijing to US
58.article_body: China asked the US to not "spread misinformation" and "exaggerate the China threat" to restrain the Asian country's development. This comes after US State Secretary Antony Blinken said China poses the "most serious long-term challenge" to the international order. "China has always been, is and will be the defender of the international order," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said.

59.title: His warmth touched my heart: Anupam on pic with Big Bang Theory's Kunal
59.article_body: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with 'The Big Bang Theory' actor Kunal Nayyar. "It was...wonderful to meet Kunal Nayyar...Our very own Delhi Boy...His warmth touched my heart," he wrote. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "It'll be fun to see you two working together," while another fan wrote, "The crossover we never expected."

60.title: Chupke Chupke an iconic film, don't want to ruin its legacy: Bhushan on remake
60.article_body: Bhushan Kumar, who had announced a remake of the 1975 film 'Chupke Chupke', has said remaking a classic is a big responsibility. "We're being very careful...It's an iconic film and we don't want to ruin the legacy," he added. The remake will be written by Luv Ranjan, who has penned films like 'De De Pyaar De' and 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama'.

61.title: Kartik's fans dance to Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 song in theatre, actor shares video
61.article_body: Kartik Aaryan took to his Instagram Stories to share a video showing his fans dancing to the title track of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' in a theatre. In the video, two women could be seen matching Kartik's steps when the song is played in the theatre along with the end credits. "Killed it," Kartik wrote while sharing the video.

62.title: Goa pastor, wife arrested for luring people to convert to Christianity
62.article_body: Police arrested Pastor Domnic D'Souza and his wife Joan on Thursday for allegedly luring people to convert to Christianity by offering them cash or promising to cure them of long-term illnesses in Goa. "They're booked for promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion and for indulging in deliberate...malicious acts intended to outrage religious feelings," police said.

63.title: China, Russia veto UN sanctions on N Korea over missile launches
63.article_body: China and Russia have vetoed a UN resolution sponsored by the US to impose more sanctions on North Korea over its renewed ballistic missile launches. The remaining 13 council members, including India, had voted in favour of the US-drafted resolution. After the vote on the resolution, Russia and China called for talks between North Korea and the US.

64.title: 7 Army soldiers killed, many hurt as vehicle falls into river in Ladakh: Reports
64.article_body: At least seven Army soldiers were killed in Ladakh's Turtuk village on Friday as the vehicle they were travelling in, skidded off the road and fell into the Shyok river, reports said. Many others have reportedly been grievously injured. The incident took place at around 9 am and there were 26 soldiers in the vehicle, reports added.

65.title: PM Modi flies B'luru-based startup's drone at Drone Mahotsav, video surfaces
65.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday flew a drone made by Bengaluru-based startup Asteria Aeronautics Limited at the Bharat Drone Mahotsav in Delhi. The drone PM Modi flew is meant for security and surveillance across different industry sectors. The Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022 is a two-day event with over 70 exhibitors displaying various use cases of drones.

66.title: Himachal approves 50% bus fare concession for women passengers
66.article_body: The Himachal Pradesh Cabinet has decided to provide 50% concession in fares to women passengers of Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) intra-state buses. The Cabinet will provide government guarantee in favour of HRTC for raising term loan of ₹160 crore to buy 360 buses and other vehicles. It'll also provide free domestic water supply to rural areas from May 1.

67.title: Asia's richest man's Adani Enterprises to buy 50% stake in General Aeronautics
67.article_body: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani's Adani Enterprises on Friday announced that it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire 50% stake in General Aeronautics Private Limited. The Bengaluru-based company provides robotic drones and drone-based solutions for crop protection. The company didn't disclose the financial details of the deal. The deal is expected to close by July 31, 2022.

68.title: He's as much hero as his son: Akshay on father of martyred policeman
68.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has shared a video interview of the father of a policeman martyred in an encounter with militants in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla. Akshay tweeted, "This father is as much a hero as his son. Salute and respect." The policeman's father said that his son sacrificed his life for the nation and he is proud he was martyred.

69.title: Miller's showing what he can do, earlier he got no chances: Tewatia
69.article_body: GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said the team's batter David Miller is showing what he can do after being given a platform. "Earlier, there were no chances given to him," added Tewatia. Miller has scored 449 runs in IPL 2022 so far. Tewatia stated he loves being under pressure as it brings the best out of him.

70.title: Iran summons Swiss envoy over US' seizure of Iranian oil: Report
70.article_body: Iranian Foreign Ministry on Friday summoned Switzerland's envoy, who represents US' interests in Iran, to protest against the American seizure of Iranian oil from a Russian-operated ship near Greece, according to a local report. The ministry has called for the immediate release of the ship and its cargo, the report said. Iran has accused the US of breaking international laws.

71.title: B'wood filmmakers thought I wasn't 'saleable' face: Pratik Gandhi
71.article_body: Actor Pratik Gandhi has revealed that Hindi producers and directors thought he was a good actor but not "a saleable face in Bollywood". He further said that he was only approached for supporting characters, adding filmmakers were hesitant to cast him in lead roles. "When I look at the projects lined up, I don't feel nervous or pressurised," Pratik added.

72.title: BTS to meet US President Biden to discuss anti-Asian hate crimes
72.article_body: K-Pop band BTS have been invited to White House to celebrate the Asian American, Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islanders (AANHPI) Heritage Month. The band will also meet US President Joe Biden to discuss the importance of diversity, inclusion and anti-Asian hate crimes. Earlier, BTS collaborated with UNICEF for 'Love Myself' campaign, which is an anti-violence campaign.

73.title: Samson has thrown wicket away too often against spinners, pacers: Harbhajan
73.article_body: Harbhajan Singh said Sanju Samson threw his wicket away "too often" against both spinners and pacers in IPL 2022. "Samson has a lot of potential but...hasn't scored as many runs. He's made good 20s and 30s but...then got out due to...carelessness," added Harbhajan. "Had he scored 70s instead of 30s, he might have been in the Indian squad," stated Harbhajan.

74.title: Ex-minister kills himself after being accused of molesting granddaughter in U'khand
74.article_body: After his daughter-in-law filed a case accusing him of molesting his granddaughter, former Uttarakhand minister Rajendra Bahuguna climbed a water tank and shot himself dead on Wednesday. Bahuguna, 59, reportedly called the police from his home in Haldwani and told them about his plan. He killed himself after the police arrived.

75.title: Why shame Arunachal: Mahua on IAS officer's transfer over Delhi stadium row
75.article_body: Commenting on IAS officer couple Sanjeev Khirwar and Rinku Dugga's transfer to Ladakh and Arunachal Pradesh respectively, TMC's Mahua Moitra tweeted, "Why shame Arunachal by transferring errant Delhi bureaucrat?" Mahua asked Home Ministry, "Why pay lip service...treat Northeast like a dump for your rubbish?" The couple was accused of using a Delhi government-run stadium for walking their dog.

76.title: Former champion Halep loses to 19-year-old Zheng at French Open
76.article_body: Former champion Simona Halep lost to 19-year-old Qinwen Zheng 6-2, 2-6, 1-6  in second round of women's singles at French Open on Thursday. Meanwhile, world number one Iga Swiatek beat American Alison Riske 6-0, 6-2 for her 30th consecutive win. In men's singles, second-seeded Daniil Medvedev entered the third round following a 6-3, 6-4, 6-3 win against Serbian Laslo Djere.

77.title: China's FAW Group considers buying stake in DiDi Global: Report
77.article_body: Chinese automaker FAW Group is considering acquiring a significant stake in DiDi Global, Bloomberg reported. The state-owned firm has reached out to DiDi's top executives regarding its interest in becoming a major shareholder in it. Earlier, DiDi's shareholders had given their approval to the firm to delist from the US following a crackdown by Chinese regulators.

78.title: Disturbed by MLAs' photo sessions, Speaker bans selfies in UP Assembly
78.article_body: Disturbed by continuous photo sessions of MLAs, Uttar Pradesh Assembly Speaker Satish Mahana on Friday announced a ban on taking selfies inside the Assembly premises. The mobile phones of MLAs will be confiscated if found taking selfies and carrying out photo sessions, he said. The use of personal cameras in Assembly and gallery area during proceedings has also been banned.

79.title: Kapiva releases user stories of losing over 10 kgs with Get Slim Juice
79.article_body: In videos shared by Kapiva, Akanksha S shared how Get Slim Juice helped her lose 13 kgs in 6 months, while Tritoy M claimed to lose 24 kgs gained after spondylitis. Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda has reported that the juice with 12 herbs was deemed effective by 90% of users for boosting metabolism and reducing appetite for sustainable weight loss.

80.title: 2-month-old girl undergoes rare cataract surgery at Noida's PGICH
80.article_body: Doctors at Noida's Postgraduate Institute of Child Health successfully operated upon a two-month-old girl who was born with a cataract in her both eyes. While the cataract is fully removed from the left eye, the surgery on the right eye is due. Doctors said the small size of the girl's eye was the biggest challenge, making it a rare procedure.

81.title: More than firecrackers biomass burning worsens Delhi's air: Study
81.article_body: IIT Delhi researchers-led study has found that "biomass burning emissions rather than fireworks drive poor air quality in Delhi during the days following Diwali". Researchers found that metal content in PM2.5 levels rose by 1,100% during Diwali and that fireworks alone accounted for 95% of the metal. The study added that the impact of fireworks plummeted in around 12 hours.

82.title: Tuition teacher rapes, impregnates 17-yr-old student in Guj; arrested
82.article_body: A tuition teacher, Nainesh Damor, has been arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating a 17-year-old student in Gujarat's Dahod. The girl alleged that the accused filmed her while using the washroom at coaching centre in February and threatened to circulate the video if she didn't develop physical relations with him. He raped her multiple times after this, she claimed.

83.title: Japan to restart idled nuclear power plants: PM Kishida
83.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said that "with priority in safety", the country will take concrete steps to restart idled nuclear power plants to make maximum use of nuclear power to stabilise energy prices and supply. The government isn't considering replacing existing nuclear power plants with new ones, Kishida added. Dozens of Japan's reactors were idled after the Fukushima nuclear disaster.

84.title: Meta updates its Privacy Policy, allows Indian users to choose not to accept
84.article_body: Meta has announced that it has rewritten its Privacy Policy to make it easier to understand and is also updating its Terms of Service. The new policy covers Facebook, Instagram, Messenger and other Meta products. Users in India will have the option to accept these changes or not, without any impact on how they access their products, Meta said.

85.title: Google in talks to join India's open e-commerce network ONDC: Report
85.article_body: Google is in talks with the central government to integrate its shopping services with the country’s Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC), as per a report by Reuters. Modelled around the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) project, ONDC will allow buyers and sellers of e-commerce goods like grocery, food delivery and others, to transact regardless of the platform they are registered.

86.title: Uttarakhand to implement Uniform Civil Code: CM Pushkar Singh Dhami
86.article_body: Uttarakhand government has taken the decision to implement the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in the state, CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said on Friday. "Uttarakhand will be the second state after Goa to implement UCC," he added. "We will bring UCC for the people irrespective of them being from any religion and section of the society," Dhami further said.

87.title: I got a divorce, therapy: Jennifer on dealing with 'Friends' end
87.article_body: Actress Jennifer Aniston has joked that she dealt with her television show 'Friends' ending after 10 seasons by getting a divorce and going to therapy. The actress further said that she also did 'The Break-Up' and "kind of leaned into the end". Jennifer divorced actor Brad Pitt in 2005 after being married for five years and together for seven years.

88.title: India was and is an important stakeholder in Afghanistan: NSA Doval
88.article_body: Taking part in the 4th Regional Security Dialogue on Afghanistan, National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval said that India was and is an important stakeholder in Afghanistan. "Special relationship with people of Afghanistan over centuries will guide India's approach, nothing can change this," Doval added. Doval also told his counterparts that the people of Afghanistan have a special place.

89.title: Mother, 2 daughters kill selves after police raid their home in UP
89.article_body: Six persons, including a sub-inspector, were booked after a woman and her two daughters died by suicide after police raided their house in a village in Uttar Pradesh. Police were looking for the woman's 22-year-old son, who had eloped with a Dalit woman and was accused of kidnapping her. The woman's husband claimed police abused and misbehaved with the deceased.

90.title: No one will remember Pant if he only plays white-ball cricket: Sehwag
90.article_body: Former India batter Virender Sehwag has said that no one would remember much about wicket-keeper Rishabh Pant if he only plays in white-ball cricket. "Test cricket is the ultimate cricket," Sehwag said. "Why does Virat Kohli emphasise so much on playing Tests? He knows that if he plays 100-150 Tests, he will be immortalised in the record books," he added.

91.title: ED summons ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah in money laundering case
91.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned the National Conference president and former Jammu and Kashmir CM, Farooq Abdullah, in connection with a money laundering case in Delhi on May 31. The case pertains to alleged financial irregularities in the Jammu and Kashmir Cricket Association (JKCA). ED in 2020 had attached Abdullah's assets worth ₹11.86 crore in the case.

92.title: PMC appoints NEERI as consultant to upgrade Vaikunth crematorium
92.article_body: National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) has been appointed as a consultant by Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to upgrade Vaikunth Smashan Bhoomi in a bid to reduce air pollution. NEERI will be paid ₹15 lakh for the consultation, the civic body said. Earlier, NEERI had conducted a study to assess the extent of air pollution caused by the crematorium.

93.title: Why did NCB give clean chit to Aryan Khan in cruise drugs case?
93.article_body: According to an NCB official, Aryan Khan was given clean chit in cruise drugs case as no physical evidence was found against him. Confession statement taken by first team had discrepancy and chargesheet can't be filed just on WhatsApp chats, the official said. He added they followed the principle of proof beyond reasonable doubt to come to the conclusion.

94.title: Woman molested in Meta VR as another user watched, passed vodka around: Report
94.article_body: A 21-year-old female researcher's avatar was allegedly sexually assaulted by a male avatar in Meta's Virtual Reality (VR) platform Horizon Worlds, a report has said. Footage of the alleged assault reportedly showed another user watching it and passing a bottle of vodka around. The two male avatars are also seen making lewd comments in the footage, reports said.

95.title: Meghan Markle visits Texas to pay respect to mass shooting victims
95.article_body: Duchess of Sussex Meghan Markle visited the memorial in Texas' Uvalde to pay respect to those who were killed in the elementary school mass shooting. As per her spokesperson, Meghan made the visit in a personal capacity as a mother to offer condolences and support in person. A gunman killed 21 people including 19 children at the school on Wednesday.

96.title: Israeli series 'Fauda' director Rotem Shamir to helm Indian film 'Garud'
96.article_body: Filmmaker Rotem Shamir, who directed Israeli thriller series 'Fauda', has been roped in to helm the Indian film 'Garud', which is based on the Afghan rescue crisis. The forthcoming project will be produced by Ajay Kapoor and Subhash Kale. Speaking about his collaboration with Rotem, Ajay said, "[He]...has a great experience in the sensibilities that we're looking at for Garud."

97.title: Priyanka, Arjun Kapoor pay tribute to 'Goodfellas' star Ray Liotta
97.article_body: Priyanka Chopra, Ranveer Singh and Arjun Kapoor paid tribute to 'Goodfellas' actor Ray Liotta, who passed away aged 67. Priyanka shared Liotta's picture on Instagram with a broken heart emoji. "Rest in peace goodfella," wrote Arjun Kapoor on his Instagram Story. Actor Ranveer Singh also shared a picture of the late actor on his Instagram Story with caption, "1954-2022. #RayLiotta."

98.title: Pune city reported more than 30 murders from Jan to April: Data
98.article_body: Pune city reported more than 30 murders in four months, i.e. from January to April, according to data provided by the Crime Branch of Pune Police. Reportedly, 14 murders took place due to 'flimsy reasons'. Notably, in a recent case, a 30-year-old pedestrian in Pune was allegedly stoned to death by two motorcycle-borne youths in a road rage incident.

99.title: We need more heavy weapons to fight Russia: Ukraine Foreign Min
99.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said the country needs more heavy weapons to fight Russia. "The only position where Russia is better than us, it's the amount of heavy weapons they have. Without artillery...multiple launch rocket systems we won't be able to push them back," he said. Kuleba added that the situation in the east of the country is "dire".

100.title: 7 deaths in past 15 days in Sirsa due to drug overdose: Hooda
100.article_body: Former Haryana Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda has alleged that seven deaths have taken place in the past 15 days in Sirsa district due to drug "overdose". "In Sirsa, during the last 8 years, more than 1.25 lakh people have visited the civil hospital for de-addiction. This is only the figure that has come to the fore," Hooda said.

101.title: SUV carrying 30 liquor bottles runs over ASI in Bihar, owner booked
101.article_body: A Bihar Police Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) was run over by an SUV carrying 30 liquor bottles in Siwan district when he tried to intercept it to prevent smuggling of liquor. Another policeman was injured in the accident, police said, adding that the vehicle's owner has been booked. The SUV dragged the ASI for about 50 metres before overturning, officers said.

102.title: Maker of US school shooter's rifle posted image of kid with rifle on lap
102.article_body: Daniel Defense, the manufacturer of the rifle used in the mass school shooting in Texas on Tuesday, had used a toddler to advertise a similar weapon just eight days before the incident. The company has been criticised after screenshots of the advertisement circulated on social media. The 18-year-old shooter killed 21 people including 19 kids.

103.title: It's like ragging in colleges: Kamal Haasan on north-south cinema debate
103.article_body: Speaking on the controversy around north-south cinema, Kamal Haasan said, "It is topical, temporary, and it will pass." "It's like ragging in colleges. They then become very great friends and miss each other, they later come and hug each other with tears..it's a lack of understanding about what a diverse country India is," Haasan added.

104.title: Woman succumbs to burn injuries in suspected dowry death case in UP
104.article_body: A woman succumbed to her burn injuries a day after allegedly being set ablaze by her in-laws in Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit. The accused demanded ₹2 lakh from the woman's family as a dowry which the latter was unable to fulfil, the deceased's family members alleged. Notably, the deceased got married in 2021 to a person in the district's Saijna village.

105.title: Will give away most of my wealth; kids to get the family house: Moderna CEO
105.article_body: Moderna CEO Stéphane Bancel told Bloomberg in an interview that he plans to donate the bulk of his family wealth. The 49-year-old billionaire said, "[My kids] will get the family house, you know. But the rest we're going to give away." Bancel holds a 1.36% stake in Moderna and has an estimated net worth of $4.1 billion, as per Bloomberg.

106.title: I feel Rakhi should wear less glamorous, more covered dresses: Boyfriend Adil
106.article_body: Rakhi Sawant's boyfriend and Bengaluru-based businessman Adil Khan Durrani said in an interview that he feels Rakhi should wear dresses which are "less glamorous and more covered". Rakhi, during the same interview, was asked if Adil is okay with her working in the entertainment industry, to which she replied, "He has never told me that I should quit my work."

107.title: Govt hikes third-party motor insurance premium after 2 yrs; effective from Jun 1
107.article_body: The Centre has hiked the third-party motor insurance premium for various categories of vehicles from June 1 after a gap of two years. Among the revised rates, for private cars with a 1,000 cc engine, the premium has been hiked to ₹2,094 from ₹2,072 and for two-wheelers with 150 cc-350 cc engine capacity, the premium has been increased to ₹1,366.

108.title: Manushi has a very sharp memory, she memorises everyone's dialogues: Akshay
108.article_body: Akshay Kumar, while talking about his 'Prithviraj' co-star Manushi Chhillar, said that she has a very sharp memory. "She used to memorise all dialogues, hers, mine as well as other actors. She could remember the toughest of words," added Akshay. 'Prithviraj' marks the Bollywood debut of Manushi, who'll be seen portraying Princess Sanyogita in the upcoming film.

109.title: Sangram Singh, Payal Rohatgi to have destination wedding on July 9
109.article_body: Wrestler Sangram Singh has stated that he will get married to actress Payal Rohatgi in a destination wedding on July 9. Sangram added that they are currently finalising a venue for the "low-key affair" in Ahmedabad or Udaipur. The couple is also planning to host a reception for their friends in Mumbai. Sangram and Payal have been together since 2011.

110.title: Human genome of Pompeii victim found in 1930s sequenced for 1st time
110.article_body: The genome of a Pompeii man who died after Mount Vesuvius' eruption in 79 AD has been successfully sequenced for the first time. The scientists extracted DNA from two victims, a man and a woman, whose remains were found in the 1930s. The man was aged between 35-40 and DNA sequences suggested he may have had tuberculosis before his death.

111.title: Robbers throw chilli powder in Gurugram petrol pump staffer's eyes
111.article_body: Six men were arrested for trying to rob a Gurugram petrol pump employee  by throwing chilli powder in his eyes, police said. The staffer was going to a bank to deposit cash worth ₹16.08 lakh he had collected. He said the accused, who tried to snatch his bag, escaped after he raised an alarm and ran towards the bank.

112.title: 19-yr-old girl falls from 5th floor of her house in Delhi, dies
112.article_body: A 19-year-old girl died after falling from her house's fifth floor in Delhi on Tuesday, police said. A small diary has reportedly been recovered from the deceased's possession wherein she has asked one of her family members to take care of themselves. Her family has said that she was struggling with obesity, which was a cause of concern for her.

113.title: Warning added to Stranger Things 4 premiere after Texas school shooting
113.article_body: Netflix has added a warning note to 'Stranger Things 4' premiere following the Texas school shooting incident. "We filmed this season of 'Stranger Things' a year ago. But given the recent tragic shooting at a school in Texas, viewers may find...opening scene of episode 1 distressing," the note read. Notably, 19 children and two adults were killed in the incident.

114.title: Indian cricket's man for all seasons: Jaffer to Shastri on 60th birthday
114.article_body: Taking to Twitter to wish Ravi Shastri on his 60th birthday on Friday, Wasim Jaffer wrote, "Happy birthday to Indian cricket's man for all seasons." He added, "Pick any iconic moment in Indian cricket in last few decades and you'll find Shastri there. On the field, in...commentary box or in...dressing room." Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Keep rocking the way you do."

115.title: 25-yr-old Dalit man killed over inter-faith relationship in K'taka, 2 held
115.article_body: A 25-year-old Dalit man, identified as Vijaya Kamble, was allegedly murdered over a relationship with a girl from another religion in Karnataka's Kalaburagi, police said. The girl's brother and his associate were arrested in connection with the murder, police added. The brother had threatened to cut off Vijaya's head if he didn't break off the relationship, the victim's mother alleged.

116.title: 'Woh badmash hai': Manoj Tiwari on Owaisi's remark on Gyanvapi case
116.article_body: Reacting to AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's remark that Muslims won't give up the Gyanvapi Mosque, BJP MP Manoj Tiwari said, "Woh (Owaisi) badmash hai (He is a troublemaker)." "Only want to say this that where the proof is in front of us, no one has to fight. Let's have faith in the judiciary, we will accept court's verdict," Tiwari added.

117.title: Colombia police kill drug trafficker who escaped jail dressed as prison guard
117.article_body: One of Colombia's most-wanted drug traffickers, Juan Larinson Castro, was killed in a police operation on Thursday, the government said. The 41-year-old had escaped from a maximum-security jail in the capital, Bogotá, in March this year while dressed as a prison guard. Castro was accused of being allied with Mexican cartels and of shipping tonnes of cocaine to the US.

118.title: Ex-Haryana CM Chautala gets 4-yr jail, fined ₹50 lakh over disproportionate assets
118.article_body: A special CBI Court in Delhi on Friday sentenced former Haryana CM OP Chautala to four years imprisonment in a disproportionate assets case. The court also imposed a ₹50 lakh fine on Chautala and ordered the confiscation of four of his properties. The 87-year-old was convicted by the court last week.

119.title: People want to put my baby in microwave: Amber on threats after Depp's defamation lawsuit
119.article_body: Actress Amber Heard has spoken about the threats she has experienced after she countered Johnny Depp's defamation lawsuit with her own counterclaims. "People want to kill me and they tell me so every day...People want to put my baby in the microwave," she stated. "I would not wish this situation on my worst enemy," Amber told the jury.

120.title: Policemen suffocate black man to death in smoke-filled trunk of car in Brazil
120.article_body: Brazilians have responded with outrage after a video showing a black man being suffocated to death by policemen in smoke-filled trunk of their car surfaced on social media. Genivaldo de Jesus Santos, 38, was stopped by the federal highway police in the city of Umbaúba on Wednesday. The man can be heard screaming in the video.

121.title: Teen girl dies after coming under wheels of school bus in B'luru
121.article_body: A 16-year-old girl died after coming under the wheels of a school bus belonging to Delhi Public School in Bengaluru on Thursday. The girl was triple riding on a bike with two others when the bus knocked them down. She was killed instantly, while the two others sustained injuries. The bus driver abandoned the vehicle and fled from the spot.

122.title: Researchers discover lost city with cosmic link in the Amazon
122.article_body: The ruins of a vast ancient civilization that thrived from 500 to 1400 AD have been discovered in the Bolivian Amazon. The settlements that stretched across some 207 square kilometres included pyramids, causeways, canals, ramparts, elevated "forest islands" and buildings arranged in ways that hint at cosmological worldview. As per the study, the structures were built by the Casarabe culture.

123.title: 14-year-old boy detained for sodomising 4-year-old boy in Greater Noida
123.article_body: A 14-year-old boy has been detained for allegedly sodomising a four-year-old neighbour in Greater Noida's Surajpur area, police said. "We received information on Wednesday...and found the four-year-old boy was bleeding," police added. "The accused locked the door and forced himself on the four-year-old. As he screamed, the family members of both the boys rushed to the room," police stated.

124.title: Adani Wilmar best-performing Asia IPO among firms that raised over $100 mn in 2022
124.article_body: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani's Adani Wilmar is the best-performing stock among 121 Asian companies that listed on the stock exchanges after raising over $100 million this year. Shares of Adani Wilmar have almost tripled since their market debut. Notably, almost two-thirds of Asia's new stock listings are trading in the red amid rising interest rates and the Russia-Ukraine war.

125.title: Kohli, Dhoni are made of different mettle; maybe Rahul isn't: Manjrekar
125.article_body: Sanjay Manjrekar said Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni love the responsibility of being the captains and key players of their sides. "Rohit Sharma...generally likes that...responsibility," added Manjrekar. Discussing KL Rahul's 79 in IPL 2022's Eliminator, Manjrekar stated Rahul is temperamentally "not" suited to take such responsibility. "They are...made of different mettle...maybe Rahul isn't," he said.

126.title: 76 critical spots prone to flooding identified in Pune, 59 cleared
126.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has identified 76 critical spots that are prone to flooding or waterlogging, officials said, adding that 59 of these were cleared till May 23. The deadline for pre-monsoon cleaning work is May 31 and officials said work will be completed "well before monsoon arrives". PMC also identified 373 culverts, of which 305 have been cleared.

127.title: Revenue from sale of liquor dipped in GB Nagar: Officials
127.article_body: Revenue from sale of liquor has dipped across GB Nagar in past few months, the excise department officials said, attributing the fall to neighbouring Delhi's heavy discounts on liquor. "We are struggling to even meet the set targets," the officials added. The department, which was given the target of ₹137 crore for May, collected only ₹85 crore till May 25.

128.title: US-based Joby Aviation gets 1st FAA approval for commercial air taxi service
128.article_body: US-based electric aviation company Joby Aviation has said that it has received its first certification from the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) that allows it to begin its air taxi operations commercially with an aircraft. However, Joby Aviation still needs two more certifications before it can legally fly passengers. The company has aimed to launch its air taxi service by 2024.

129.title: Gay roles 'sanitised' as actors aren't comfortable: Filmmaker Onir
129.article_body: Filmmaker Onir, while talking about non-queer actors playing queer roles, said he has noticed male actors getting awkward while filming intimate scenes with other men. He stated that it's this inhibition of actors that gay roles have to be 'sanitised' on screen. "They've no qualms about playing a rapist but playing...gay man onscreen is an issue for many," Onir added.

130.title: Was one of the top models: Anupamaa's Sudhanshu shares pic from modelling days
130.article_body: Sudhanshu Pandey, who plays Vanraj Shah on show 'Anupamaa', took to Instagram to share a throwback picture from his modelling days. "This photo is [from]...when I was barely 20-21 and was already one of the top models in the country," the 47-year-old actor wrote. Reacting to his post, actor Taher Shabbir wrote, "Only that you look the same even now."

131.title: Excited to play final in Ahmedabad, familiar with pitch: Yash Dayal
131.article_body: Gujarat Titans pacer Yash Dayal has said that their franchise is "excited to play the final" at their home ground, Narendra Modi Stadium, in Ahmedabad. "Our entire focus is on playing well in the final. We are familiar with the pitch and ground of Ahmedabad as our camp was earlier located," the 24-year-old IPL debutant said.

132.title: Don't expect Russia to terminate space station cooperation: ESA
132.article_body: ESA Director-General Josef Aschbacher has said he doesn't expect Russia to terminate the joint operation of the International Space Station (ISS) with the West for the foreseeable future. "It is not possible...to separate the two units [Russian and Western parts] because they are linked together," Aschbacher added. "We do need Russia, and Russia needs the Western part," he further said.

133.title: Pune village imposes ban on widow customs after govt order
133.article_body: After the Maharashtra government's directive, Pune's Udachiwadi village has implemented a ban on funerary customs linked to widows such as wiping off the vermilion and breaking their bangles. After the passing of the resolution at the gram sabha, vermilion was applied to the foreheads of a few widows. Previously, Kolhapur's Hervad and Mangaon villages had also passed the resolution.

134.title: DU college principal booked 2 yrs after ad hoc prof alleged caste bias
134.article_body: FIR was lodged against Delhi University's Daulat Ram College Principal Savita Roy and Registrar Vikas Gupta, two years after an ad hoc assistant professor alleged caste bias. "I didn't fit into her stereotype of what a Dalit woman should be like," complainant said. She had accused Roy of firing her without notice and discriminating against her on basis of caste.

135.title: Injured S Korean volunteer fighter in Ukraine returns home, faces probe
135.article_body: An ex-South Korean naval special forces soldier returned home on Friday after fighting for Ukraine as a volunteer fighter to recover from injuries. Upon arrival, Rhee Keun said he was ready to face a police investigation over suspicion of defying South Korea's government's ban on travel to Ukraine. Keun added that he wants to go to Ukraine "because...war hasn't ended".

136.title: CBI seized my confidential documents during raid: Karti Chidambaram
136.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram has alleged that the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) seized his sensitive documents during the raid on him in connection with the Chinese visa scam case. "The CBI seized my highly confidential and sensitive personal notes and papers pertaining to Parliamentary Standing Committee for Information and Technology, of which I am a Member," Chidambaram said.

137.title: Most dinosaurs were warm-blooded: Research
137.article_body: After analysing the bones of dinosaurs that indicated how much the individual animals breathed in last hour of their life, researchers have concluded that most dinosaurs were warm-blooded. According to research, the lizard-hipped dinosaurs had low metabolic rates as compared to the cold-blooded modern animals. Moreover, the bird-hipped dinosaurs were warm or even hot-blooded, the study has found.

138.title: Taj Mahal is mine, Madurai temple is yours: Haasan on B'wood vs south debate
138.article_body: Kamal Haasan, during the promotion of his film 'Vikram: Hitlist', said he doesn't understand the north vs south cinema debate, adding, "I'm an Indian, what are you?" "For me, the Taj Mahal is mine and...Madurai temple is yours. Kanniyakumari is as much yours as Kashmir is mine," he added. 'Vikram: Hitlist' will release in Hindi, Kannada, Telugu, Malayalam and Tamil.

139.title: I conduct surprise inspection of govt work with help of drones: PM Modi
139.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking at the two-day Bharat Drone Mahotsav, spoke about how he uses drones for surprise inspections. He said, "If I want to check the quality of government work, I don’t...inform in advance. Because then everything will be in place. If I send a drone, the requisite information is collected and officials don't even get to know."

140.title: Babar is 100% capable of becoming first no.1 batter across formats: Karthik
140.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said Pakistan captain Babar Azam is "hundred percent" capable of becoming the first player to be ranked as the number one batter across formats. "[Babar] is a high-quality player who is at the peak of his batting prowess," added Karthik. "[He's] been phenomenal in all...formats...and...has done well in different batting positions," stated Karthik.

141.title: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan given clean chit by NCB in cruise drugs case
141.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan has been given clean chit by Narcotics Control Bureau in the cruise drugs case. "All the accused persons were found in possession of narcotics except Aryan and Mohak," a statement by Sanjay Kumar Singh, DDG (Operations), NCB, read. "A complaint against 14 persons under various sections of the NDPS Act is being filed," Singh said.

142.title: Eastern Railway achieves 100% electrification of 2,848 km-network
142.article_body: Eastern Railway achieved 100% electrification of its entire 2,848 kilometre-long network, an official said on Friday. This comes after completion of electrification work in the 41 kilometre-long Hansdiha-Godda section in Jharkhand. The speed trial was conducted by the Commissioner of Railway Safety at 103 km per hour, Kolkata-headquartered zonal railway's spokesperson Ekalabya Chakraborty said.

143.title: Economic recovery is underway in spite of headwinds: RBI in its annual report
143.article_body: In its annual report released on Friday, the RBI while referring to the Indian economy said that "a recovery is underway in spite of headwinds". Highlighting "structural reforms", RBI said that the future path of growth will be conditioned by addressing "supply-side bottlenecks and calibrating monetary and fiscal policy support to aggregate demand and structural reforms".

144.title: Ronaldo will be a massive problem for Man Utd next season: Carragher
144.article_body: Ex-Liverpool player Jamie Carragher said Cristiano Ronaldo will be a "massive problem" for Manchester United next season if he does not get a chance to play every week. "We've seen it this season. Even when he's coming off...he's kicked up a fuss," added Carragher. Carragher stated he has consistently said throughout this season that Ronaldo was "not" a good signing.

145.title: Drones' usage will rise in agriculture, defence, sports: PM Modi
145.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi after inaugurating the drone festival in Delhi said, "Use of drones will rise in sectors such as agriculture, sports, defence and disaster management." He added that India has the potential of becoming a global drone hub. "There was an environment of 'indifference' towards the use of technology in governance before 2014," he added.

146.title: Mumbai YouTuber arrested for committing thefts to fund lavish lifestyle
146.article_body: A 30-year-old YouTuber, Abhimanyu Gupta, was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly committing house break-ins to fund his lavish lifestyle. Police have seized 14 mobile phones, sharp weapons, fake jewellery and foreign currency from him. Apart from valuables, he'd also steal shoes and slippers kept outside house and wore cap and face mask to conceal his identity during thefts, police said.

147.title: Indian Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa loses to world no. 2 in Chessable Masters final
147.article_body: Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa lost to world no. 2 Ding Liren in the tie-break of the Meltwater Champions Chess Tour Chessable Masters 2022 online tournament final. The 16-year-old from Chennai fought back to win the second set after having lost the opener. Praggnanandhaa had defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in the fifth round of the tournament.

148.title: Musk calls recession 'good thing', says, 'Money raining on fools for too long'
148.article_body: Responding to a follower who asked him if recession was approaching, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Yes, but this is actually a good thing." He added, "It has been raining money on fools for too long. Some bankruptcies need to happen." In another tweet, he also said that the recession may last for "about 12 to 18 months".

149.title: Man arrested for raping, attempting to kill 5-yr-old daughter in Pune
149.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his five-year-old daughter and then attempting to kill her, Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police said. The man allegedly went to his daughter and she resisted, police added. He had an argument with his wife when she intervened and the accused allegedly threw their daughter on the floor and tried to strangle her, police stated.

150.title: Drone industry to reach ₹15,000 cr turnover by 2026: Scindia
150.article_body: Addressing the 'Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022' event, Union Minister for Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia said, "It is estimated that the drone industry will reach ₹15,000 crore turnover by the year 2026." Currently, there are 270 drone startups in India, Scindia said during the event. 'Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022' is a two-day event (May 27-28) being held in Delhi's Pragati Maidan.

151.title: Annual 'fish prasadam' distribution in Hyd scrapped for 3rd consecutive yr
151.article_body: The annual 'fish prasadam' distribution in Hyderabad has been cancelled for a third consecutive year. The Bathini Goud family has decided not to organise the event as precautionary measure amid COVID-19. Notably, the 'prasadam', which consists of a live murrel fish with a yellow herbal paste, is touted to provide relief to asthma patients if taken for three consecutive years.

152.title: Delhi riots accused who pointed gun at police welcomed by huge crowd during parole
152.article_body: Delhi riots accused Shahrukh Pathan, who had pointed a gun at a policeman, recently arrived at his family residence on a four-hour parole. Pathan was welcomed by a huge crowd on his arrival, a video on social media showed. In a video dated May 23, people can be heard cheering and whistling as they flock around Pathan.

153.title: Tesla submits application to expand German plant by 100 hectares
153.article_body: Tesla has submitted an application to expand its German plant by another 100 hectares, expanding its area by a third, Gruenheide Mayor Arne Christiani was quoted as saying. The firm plans to build a freight station, logistics areas and parking spaces on the additional space. The proposal will be discussed at a municipality meeting on June 2.

154.title: 3-year-old run over by reversing water tanker in Bengaluru
154.article_body: A three-year-old girl Pratiksha Bhat was run over by a water tanker outside her house at Serenity Layout near Bengaluru's Sarjapur Road area. The incident took place around 12.10 pm on Thursday when the tanker driver, after unloading water at a nearby apartment, was trying to reverse the vehicle. He did not notice Pratiksha playing and knocked her down.

155.title: China is greater long-term threat than Russia: US State Secy
155.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken said Russia & President Vladimir Putin "pose a present threat", but America sees China as a long-term threat to global stability. "China is the only country" that has both the intent and the might to reshape the international order, he added. Blinken further said the US isn't looking for "conflict or...new Cold War" with China.

156.title: Ex-Twitter official accuses Dorsey of 'backstabbing' Twitter board by helping Musk
156.article_body: An ex-Twitter board member has accused former CEO Jack Dorsey of "backstabbing" his company’s board by helping Tesla CEO Elon Musk acquire it. Jason Goldman said that after it was agreed to bring Musk on as a director, Dorsey "shared his personal view that Twitter would be able to better focus on execution as a private company".

157.title: Model found dead at her home 2 days after model friend was found hanging in Kolkata
157.article_body: A model has been found dead at her residence in Kolkata's Patuli area, the second such incident in three days, the police said. Manjusha Neogi's mother claimed that her daughter was suffering from "acute depression" after the death of her friend and colleague in the industry, Bidisha De Majumder. Bidisha was found hanging at her rented flat on Wednesday.

158.title: GB Nagar's govt schools get loudspeakers taken down from religious sites
158.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police has facilitated the donation of the loudspeakers, which were taken down from religious places, to various government schools in the district. Over 10 loudspeakers were willingly donated by the representatives of various temples and mosques, police said. However, the schools have been asked to not exceed the prescribed decibel levels while using the loudspeakers.

159.title: We were scared of receiving backlash: Deepak on 'Roadies' spoof
159.article_body: 'Panchayat' director Deepak Kumar Mishra, who played Raghu Ram in Roadies' spoof titled 'Rowdies', spoke about the show and said, "We were...careful to not go personal." "We were scared of receiving a backlash and we handled it with maturity," he added. Deepak further said that the team decided to spoof 'Roadies' because of its popularity.

160.title: 15 hurt as bus falls into gorge in Palghar, driver's negligence suspected
160.article_body: At least 15 people were injured after bus they were travelling in fell into a 25-foot-deep gorge on Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway in Palghar on Friday. One of the passengers alleged that the driver was inebriated and drove the bus rashly. The medical examination of the driver who is severely injured will be conducted later and action will be taken, police said.

161.title: Being benched was tough to deal with: MI's ₹8.25 crore buy Tim David
161.article_body: Talking about being benched by MI in IPL 2022 after being picked for ₹8.25 crore in the mega auction, all-rounder Tim David said, "It's tough to deal with...and...just a period of time you have to accept." "I worked really hard on my batting," added David. He had a strike rate of 216.27 in IPL 2022 having played eight matches.

162.title: Google hit with 2nd probe in UK over its ad practices
162.article_body: The UK CMA has launched its second investigation into Google's advertising practices saying it could be distorting competition. "We're worried that Google may be using its position...to favour its own services to the detriment of its rivals, of its customers and ultimately of consumers," the agency said. Earlier, the agency had probed Google and Meta's 'Jedi Blue' agreement.

163.title: Congress a 'torn-old party', has lost vision, relevance: BJP
163.article_body: BJP national spokesperson and Rajya Sabha MP Sudhanshu Trivedi on Thursday called Congress a "torn-old party" that has lost its "vision". "The Congress is progressively moving towards a stage where its relevance and necessity is completely lost," Trivedi said. His comments came after Congress released a booklet highlighting failures of BJP-led central government ahead of its eighth anniversary.

164.title: Free me from 'dishonourable' post, give it to your Principal Secy: Raj Min to CM
164.article_body: Rajasthan Sports Minister Ashok Chandna in a tweet requested CM Ashok Gehlot to free him from his "dishonourable" ministerial post and give the charge of all the departments under him to CM's Principal Secretary Kuldeep Ranka. "Anyway, he is the minister of all the departments," he added. Chandna holds Sports and Youth Affairs, Skill Development, Employment and other portfolios.

165.title: Old pic of 'Panchayat' actors Neena Gupta and Raghubir goes viral
165.article_body: An old picture of 'Panchayat' actors Neena Gupta and Raghubir Yadav, apparently from 1982, has gone viral on social media. In the picture, Neena and Raghubir are seen holding mics. Neena plays village sarpanch, Manju Devi, in 'Panchayat' while Raghubir Yadav plays her husband, Brij Bhushan Dubey. Directed by Deepak Kumar Mishra, 'Panchayat' also stars Jitendra Kumar.

166.title: Despite personal setbacks, Karthik came back well: Shoaib Akhtar
166.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar spoke on Indian batter Dinesh Karthik (36) making a comeback into India's T20I squad for the home series against South Africa. "I usually avoid speaking about people's personal lives. What I want to say here is that he (Karthik) had suffered some setbacks in his personal life, but he came back really well," Akhtar said.

167.title: Who were the highest paid female CEOs in the US in 2021?
167.article_body: Advanced Micro Devices' CEO Lisa T Su was the highest-paid female executive at $29.5 million in the US in 2021. She was followed by General Motors' CEO Mary T Barra at $29.1 million, General Dynamics' Phebe N Novakovic at $23.6 million, Nasdaq's Adena Friedman at $20 million and Northrop Grumman's Kathy J Warden at $19.5 million.

168.title: BJP will revive 36,000 temples destroyed by Mughals: KS Eshwarappa
168.article_body: BJP leader KS Eshwarappa said that his party will "revive" all the temples which were destroyed by Mughals. "Why was a temple shifted in Srirangapatna and a mosque built in its place? A total of 36,000 temples were destroyed by the Mughals. We will revive all of them," he said. Eshwarappa was recently sacked from Karnataka cabinet over corruption allegations.

169.title: Naxals set 6 construction vehicles on fire in Odisha
169.article_body: Naxalites set six vehicles engaged in road construction work afire at Tala Pipili village in Odisha's Kalahandi district on Wednesday night. Over 40 Naxals reached the spot and eventually torched the vehicles for low-quality construction work, police said. Locals claimed it was an act of revenge as one of their group members was arrested recently, though police claimed he surrendered.

170.title: We compare him to Rahul Dravid, call him Dravid: Azam on Abdullah Shafique
170.article_body: Talking about batter Abdullah Shafique, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said, "Usually, we compare him to Kane Williamson and Rahul Dravid. We call him Dravid." "I personally watch and definitely enjoy Abdullah's stylish batting. He plays very clean, his stance and the way he ducks the ball are impressive," added Azam. Dravid is currently the head coach of Team India.

171.title: PM Modi inaugurates India's biggest drone festival in Delhi
171.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated the Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022, India's biggest drone festival, at the Pragati Maidan in Delhi. Prime Minister Modi had urged all those interested in tech and innovation to watch the programme, saying, "This forum brings together key stakeholders including startups with the aim of increasing India's presence in the sector."

172.title: Who were the highest paid male CEOs in the US in 2021?
172.article_body: As per the data compiled by Associated Press and Equilar, Expedia CEO Peter Kern was the highest-paid male executive at $296.2 million in the US in 2021. He was followed by Warner Bros. Discovery CEO David Zaslav at $246.6 million, ServiceNow’s William McDermott at $165.8 million, Apple's Tim Cook at $98.7 million and JPMorgan Chase’s Jamie Dimon at $84.4 million.

173.title: Iraq passes bill criminalising relations with Israel
173.article_body: Iraqi Parliament has passed a law that makes it a crime to normalise ties with Israel and violations of the law can be punishable with a death sentence or life imprisonment. A total of 275 legislators in Iraq's 329-seat assembly voted in favour of it. This comes at a time when several Arab countries have established formal ties with Israel.

174.title: Islamic State's new chief captured in Istanbul: Reports
