174.article_body: Islamic State's new leader Abu al-Hassan al-Qurayshi has been captured in a recent raid in Istanbul, according to reports quoting senior Turkish officials. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has been informed of his capture, the officials said on Thursday. Erdogan is expected to announce the arrest in the coming days, OdaTV said.

175.title: Death toll due to Assam floods, landslides rises to 30: ASDMA
175.article_body: The death toll due to floods and landslides in Assam has risen to 30, Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) said. This comes after two persons died due to drowning in floodwaters in Nagaon. Around 5.61 lakh people across 12 districts are still affected due to floods, ASDMA stated. Over 47,000 hectares of crop area has been damaged across Assam.

176.title: No political ties between Cong, JD(S) for RS, 2023 polls: Siddaramaiah
176.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has ruled out any alliance between the Congress and JD(S) for the upcoming Rajya Sabha polls and the next year's State Assembly elections. "We (Congress) will not have any political relationship with JD(S)," Siddaramaiah said. The elections for Karnataka's four Rajya Sabha seats will be held on June 10.

177.title: Madhya Pradesh Guv gives nod to ordinance on direct election of mayors
177.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Governor Mangubhai C Patel gave his nod to an ordinance proposing the direct election of mayors in municipal corporations. "People will directly elect Mayors...chairpersons and vice-chairpersons of municipal councils and nagar panchayats will be elected by corporators chosen by voters," a minister said. "Proposal will be sent to state EC for implementation," the minister stated.

178.title: Who do you trust less, politicians or billionaires: Musk asks in poll
178.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to take a poll on who the users "trust less", politicians or billionaires. Following his poll, Musk extended a challenge to US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, saying, "I dare you to run the same poll with your followers." Replying to his tweet, a user wrote, "I trust AOC more than I trust you, Elon."

179.title: Talks of RJD-JD(U) alliance all imaginary: Tejashwi Yadav
179.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav refuted all rumours of RJD attempting to forge an alliance with Janata Dal (United) and said that the speculations surrounding the alliance are "imaginary". "When I went to Delhi to meet PM Modi, it was my initiative and not of CM Nitish Kumar. Does it mean I was forging an alliance with BJP?" Tejashwi said.

180.title: Israel tells US it was behind killing of Iranian Colonel: Report
180.article_body: Israel has told the US it was responsible for the killing of an Iranian Revolutionary Guards Colonel last week, The New York Times reported. Israel reportedly said the killing was a warning to Iran to halt the operations of a covert group within the Revolutionary Guard Corps' Quds Force. Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi has vowed to avenge Sayyad Khodai's killing.

181.title: I didn't sleep for a week: Michael Owen on leaving Liverpool for Madrid
181.article_body: Discussing his transfer from Liverpool to Real Madrid in 2004, ex-England player Michael Owen said, "I didn't sleep for a week...Even on the drive to the airport, I was crying my eyes out." "Two seconds later, I was thinking...[that] I wanna be at Liverpool for the rest of my life...It was...one of those really tough...calls," added Owen.

182.title: 3 men convicted for eve-teasing, creating nuisance in Hyderabad
182.article_body: The metropolitan magistrate on Thursday convicted three persons for committing eve-teasing and creating nuisance in a drunken condition in Hyderabad. In one case, two men aged 19, were imprisoned for 37 and 19 days respectively for teasing women. In another case, a 29-year-old accused was sentenced to 112 days imprisonment for creating nuisance in drunken condition and misbehaving with ladies.

183.title: India reports 2,710 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 15,814
183.article_body: India has reported 2,710 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,628 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 15,814, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,539, according to the latest data.

184.title: 25-yr-old college dropout named youngest self-made billionaire by Forbes
184.article_body: Alexandr Wang, 25, has been named the world's youngest self-made billionaire by Forbes. Wang dropped out of MIT at the age of 19 to co-found a software company, Scale AI. His company helps in deploying artificial intelligence and generates an estimated $100 million in revenue at $7.3 billion valuation. Wang's estimated 15% stake in the company is worth $1 billion.

185.title: Senegal Health Min sacked after 11 newborn babies die in hospital fire
185.article_body: Senegal President Macky Sall on Thursday sacked Health Minister, Abdoulaye Diouf Sarr, following a fire in a hospital's neonatal ward in Tivaouane city in which 11 newborns were killed. The fire was caused by a short circuit, the city's mayor said, adding that three babies were rescued. Sall has declared three days of national mourning for the young lives lost.

186.title: I did not score much while batting second in IPL 2022: KL Rahul
186.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul said he did not score much while batting second in IPL 2022, having scored one half-century in the edition while batting second. "Generally...we did not do well chasing. It's something that we need to learn," added Rahul. LSG were knocked out of IPL 2022 following a defeat against RCB by 14 runs in the Eliminator.

187.title: SRK dances to 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai' song at Johar's b'day bash, video surfaces
187.article_body: A video showing Shah Rukh Khan dancing to the song 'Koi Mil Gaya' from the film 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai' at Karan Johar's 50th birthday bash has surfaced online. Filmmaker Farah Khan, who choreographed the song, and actor Maniesh Paul are also seen dancing with Shah Rukh. Johar made his directorial debut with 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai'.

188.title: Land worth ₹100 crore freed of encroachment in UP's Greater Noida
188.article_body: Four illegal colonies were demolished and land measuring around 50,000 square metres, estimated to be worth ₹100 crore, was freed of encroachment in UP's Greater Noida, officials said. The anti-encroachment drive was carried out by the Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA). Residential plots were being marked on the land illegally in name of some local developers, GNIDA said.

189.title: Crypto frauds pose as journalists on Twitter for users' data: Report
189.article_body: Cryptocurrency scammers have been using hijacked accounts on Twitter and even posing as journalists to lure people into using dubious platforms, compromising their data, Bloomberg reported. Scammers have also posed as members of the popular NFT collection, Bored Ape Yacht Club. Dubious platforms are asking users to provide access to their mobile cryptocurrency wallets.

190.title: Mumbai man promises people high return on crypto investment, cheats them of ₹1.50 cr
190.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a man for allegedly cheating multiple people of ₹1.50 crore by promising them high returns weekly if they invest in cryptocurrency. When the accused Jagdish Laadi was not answering the calls of one of his victims Aatish Patil, he went to Laadi's residence and found that he cheated several people using the same strategy.

191.title: No such decisions made: EY CEO on reports of audit, advisory business split
191.article_body: Amid reports of Ernst & Young considering a worldwide split of its audit and advisory businesses, CEO Carmine Di Sibio has said that "no such decisions have been made." In an internal memo to the firm's partners, the CEO said, "With the changing competitive, regulatory and market landscape, work is ongoing to evaluate strategic alternatives."

192.title: Corruption, irregularities won't be tolerated: BJP tells Himachal unit
192.article_body: The BJP has conveyed to the Himachal Pradesh leadership that allegations of corruption and irregularities against ministers and legislators won't be tolerated. It has also said that a clean record will be deciding factor for ticket distribution for the state assembly elections to be held later this year. Earlier, allegations of irregularities were made against chief secretary Ram Subhag Singh.

193.title: Waited 15 mins for seat: Harsh Vardhan on walk-out of Delhi LG's event
193.article_body: Former Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan said he waited for 15 minutes for a seat at the oath-taking ceremony of Delhi's new Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena on Thursday and walked out of the event after he didn't get a seat. "One officer made me sit on one chair. Then another officer made me vacate that seat," he tweeted.

194.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to be evicted from MP flat in Delhi by Lok Sabha Secretariat
194.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann will be evicted from his MP flat in Delhi, as per Lok Sabha Secretariat's order to the Directorate of Estates. The Directorate has been directed to initiate eviction proceedings against Mann for "unauthorised" occupation of Central government accommodation. "The said allotment stands cancelled in his name with effect from April 14," the Secretariat said.

195.title: Tsunami warning issued for Indian Ocean region after earthquake off East Timor coast
195.article_body:
A 6.2-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of East Timor on Friday, the US Geological Survey said. The Indian Ocean Tsunami Warning and Mitigation System (IOTWMS) issued a tsunami warning for the region.
It said that the quake "may be capable of generating a tsunami affecting the Indian Ocean region".

196.title: Ludhiana man pours hot oil on wife while cooking; booked
196.article_body: A man, identified as Ajaypal Singh, has been booked for reportedly pouring hot oil on his wife in Ludhiana. The 31-year-old woman alleged that her husband started harassing her for dowry soon after their marriage. On May 23, he allegedly arrived at her residence, where she lives with her daughter and poured hot oil on her while she was cooking.

197.title: Wife hires killer for ₹6 lakh to murder husband of 25 years in Delhi
197.article_body: A 40-year-old woman hired a contract killer for ₹6 lakh to murder her husband of 25 years so that she could live with her 29-year-old lover in Delhi. The woman, identified as Zeeba Qureshi, met her lover, Shoaib, on Facebook. Meanwhile, the deceased, Moinuddin Qureshi, was shot dead by the contract killer, Vinit Goswami, in Delhi's Daryaganj area, police said.

198.title: Fire breaks out at Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital, no casualty reported
198.article_body: An incident of fire was reported at Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital on Friday morning following which fire tenders were rushed to the spot. "A fire broke out in an inverter in Safdarjung Hospital...which has been doused now," Delhi Fire Department said. The cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained and there is no report of any casualty yet.

199.title: Tesla planning to build 24-hr diner & a drive-in theatre in LA: Report
199.article_body: Tesla is reportedly planning to build a 24-hour diner with a drive-in movie theatre and a supercharger station in Los Angeles. As per a report, on May 19, Tesla filed the necessary documents for this. The site will have 28 supercharger stalls and two movie screens that can accommodate over 200 people while food will reportedly be delivered to cars.

200.title: 91-yr-old former F1 chief Bernie Ecclestone arrested in Brazil for carrying gun
200.article_body: Former Formula One chief Bernie Ecclestone was arrested in Brazil for illegally carrying a gun while boarding a private plane to Switzerland. Police found an undocumented LW Seecamp .32 gun in the 91-year-old's luggage during X-ray screening. Ecclestone acknowledged owning the gun, but said he was unaware it was in his luggage at the time, police said.

201.title: 11-yr-old girl covered herself in friend's blood and played dead during US shooting
201.article_body: During the mass shooting at an elementary school in US' Texas, an 11-year-old girl covered herself in her friend's blood and played dead. Miah Cerrillo, who had bullet fragments in her back, was taken to a hospital and has now been released. "It's too much for me to play that scene over and over again," her aunt said.

202.title: Ravichandran Ashwin is a problem for RR on flat tracks: Sanjay Manjrekar
202.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin is a "problem" for RR on flat tracks as he tries a lot of variations, adding that Ashwin bowls fewer off-spinners on flat tracks. "When there is turn, then [Ashwin] becomes a dangerous bowler," stated Manjrekar. The all-rounder has picked 11 wickets in IPL 2022 so far. His current economy rate is 7.33.

203.title: Alibaba reports slowest revenue growth since 2014 amid COVID-19 outbreaks
203.article_body: Alibaba Group on Thursday reported a 9% increase in its fourth-quarter revenue, its slowest quarterly revenue growth since it went public in 2014. The company said that its core e-commerce platforms suffered due to COVID-19 outbreaks and subsequent restrictions. Notably, the company witnessed a 64% increase in revenue growth during the same quarter last year.

204.title: Fraudster offering telecom plan at bus stop, cheats man of ₹2.25 lakh in Mumbai
204.article_body: A 57-year-old businessman allegedly lost ₹2.25 lakh within minutes after a fraudster at a bus stop, claiming to be a telecom company executive, talked him into a 'lucrative' scheme in Mumbai. As per the complainant, the accused asked him to pay ₹1 on his number for verification and after that, the amount was deducted from his account in 14 transactions.

205.title: Canadian police kill man seen carrying gun near schools
205.article_body: Police shot and killed a man who was seen carrying a gun near schools in the Scarborough area in Canada on Thursday. Five schools were under lockdown as authorities tried to determine the extent of the threat. The incident comes days after an 18-year-old gunman killed 19 children and two teachers at an elementary school in US' Texas.

206.title: 'Goodfellas' actor Ray Liotta passes away at 67
206.article_body: Ray Liotta, known for his role in Martin Scorsese's 'Goodfellas', has passed away aged 67. Liotta's publicist Jennifer told The Hollywood Reporter he died on Wednesday night or early Thursday in his sleep in the Dominican Republic where he was shooting for 'Dangerous Waters'. "He's way too way young to have left us," Liotta's 'Goodfellas' co-star Robert De Niro said.

207.title: RR must be hurt after disappointing loss in Qualifier 1 vs GT: Smith
207.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain Graeme Smith said RR must be feeling "hurt" after their "disappointing" loss against GT in the IPL 2022's Qualifier 1, adding it will be a challenge for them in their Qualifier 2 against RCB. "RCB...is on a high. They'll be keen to turn it around and put back a high skill level in the game," stated Smith.

208.title: Govt actions indirectly helping extremists: Venugopal on George's arrest
208.article_body: Reacting to former MLA PC George's arrest in an alleged hate speech case, MP KC Venugopal on Thursday said that the Kerala government's action is indirectly helping the extremists. "These are all dramas," he said. "Actually, the actions...are now not to solve the issue [of] communal harmony...Their action is indirectly helping...extremists, the people who want to spread hatred," he added.

209.title: Maha MP Navneet Rana gets death threats from unknown caller, FIR lodged
209.article_body: Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana received death threats from an unknown caller following which an FIR was lodged in Delhi, an official said. She received 11 calls on Tuesday and was threatened of dire consequences if she ever recites Hanuman Chalisa or comes to Maharashtra, Rana's personal assistant said. The caller purportedly said he won't allow Rana to enter Maharashtra.

210.title: Twitter investors sue Musk for 'manipulating' firm's stock price via his tweets
210.article_body: Twitter investors have sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk, accusing him of "market manipulation" and for a decline in Twitter's stock price. They claimed Musk saved himself $156 million by not revealing that he had purchased more than 5% of Twitter by March 14. Musk's criticism of Twitter via his tweets also led to the company's share price drop, they added.

211.title: US bill bars stores from hosting apps accepting China's digital yuan
211.article_body: A bill unveiled in the US bars app stores, including Apple and Google, from hosting apps within the country that support or enable transactions in China's digital currency. It is sponsored by Senators Tom Cotton, Marco Rubio and Mike Braun. Cotton's office said the digital yuan could provide the Chinese government with "real-time visibility into all transactions on the network".

212.title: Professor reunites runaway 11-year-old girl with mother in Thane
212.article_body: An 11-year-old girl, who had run away from her home, was reunited with her mother by a professor in Thane. The incident occurred on Wednesday when Sheetal Boritkar found the girl on a Karjat-bound local train. On being suspicious, Boritkar asked the girl about her school and contacted the school officials who then informed her mother and police.

213.title: Western Railway cancels, diverts few trains due to double line work in Gujarat
213.article_body: The Western Railway cancelled and diverted few trains due to double line work between Jagudan, Ambliyasan and Dangarwa station of Mahesana - Ahmedabad section. Few of the cancelled trains are - Train No. 14821 Jodhpur - Sabarmati Express, Train No. 14820 Sabarmati - Jodhpur Express, Train No. 09434 Patan- Sabarmati DEMU, Train No. 14804 Sabarmati - Jodhpur Express.

214.title: Pune man cheated of ₹3 lakh on promise of daughter's admission in MBBS course
214.article_body: A Pune resident was cheated of ₹3 lakh by a cyber fraudster on the promise of getting the former's daughter enrolled in an MBBS course. The complainant had contacted the accused through a Facebook advertisement, police said. On the accused's directions, the complainant transferred money to different bank accounts as 'donation', police added. Notably, the unidentified accused is still absconding.

215.title: Pune Police busts gang involved in land-grabbing racket, 7 held
215.article_body: Pune Police has busted a land-grabbing racket and arrested seven people involved in selling and mortgaging lands across Maharashtra. While probing a racket of bogus identity cards used by foreigners, officials found forged documents in this regard, police said. Police seized laptops, a printer, a scanner, a counterfeit stamp making machine and other incriminating materials from the accused.

216.title: Stop playing with Russia, end senseless war: Ukraine Prez to West
216.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged the West to "stop playing" around with Russia and impose tougher sanctions on Moscow to end the war. He added, "Ukraine will always be an independent state, and it won't be broken. The only question is what price our people will have to pay for...freedom and what price Russia will pay for this senseless war."

217.title: Last few seats remaining in Manipal University for online degrees
217.article_body: Manipal University Jaipur announced that seats are filling up fast for UGC-entitled online degrees like MBA, BCom, BBA, BCA, and MCA. Students can get a degree from NAAC A+ accredited university while working, and benefit from attractive scholarships, placement assistance, free access to Coursera, and ₹50,000 worth of free e-learning courses, the University stated. Enrol today to block your seats.

218.title: 2 floors of building collapse in Delhi after blast due to LPG leak
218.article_body: The walls of the second and third floors of a building collapsed after a blast due to an LPG leak in Delhi's Chhattarpur area on Thursday, officials said. In the incident, one person was critically injured. The locals said that the smell of gas was coming from the said building for the last couple of days, police said.

219.title: Mumbai civic body to keep digital record of students' health
219.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will keep a digital health record of children studying in Mumbai Public Schools (MPS). Reports of all periodical health check-ups, specific medical condition of a child and ongoing medicines will be collated by the BMC education department. "If any child is seen developing any health issue...proactive action can be taken," an official said.

220.title: 2 terrorists who shot dead 35-year-old TV artiste Amreen killed in Kashmir
220.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir police has said that two Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists, who shot dead Kashmiri TV artiste Amreen Bhat, have been neutralised in Kashmir's Awantipora. "Heinous murder case of TV artiste Amreen Bhat solved in 24 hours...10 terrorists including three from Jaish-e-Mohammed and seven from Lashkar-e-Taiba terror outfits killed in 3 days in Kashmir Valley," IGP Kashmir Vijay Kumar said.

221.title: I'm a fan of Jack, wish he stayed on the board: Musk after Dorsey exits Twitter board
221.article_body: After former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey stepped down from the company's board, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "I'm a fan of Jack." Musk added, "Wish he would stay on the board, but I understand that he needs to move on." Dorsey had quit as Twitter CEO in November last year after handing over the post to Indian-origin Parag Agrawal.

222.title: Geetanjali Shree's 'Tomb of Sand' becomes 1st Hindi novel to win Booker Prize
222.article_body: Author Geetanjali Shree's translated Hindi novel, 'Tomb of Sand', has become the first book written in an Indian language to be awarded the International Booker Prize. Originally published in Hindi as 'Ret Samadhi', the book was translated into English by Daisy Rockwell. "I never dreamt of the Booker, I never thought I could. What a huge recognition," Geetanjali Shree said.

223.title: US govt agency asks Tesla for info on Tesla car fire in Canada
223.article_body: The US NHTSA has asked Tesla for information on a recent fire incident involving a Tesla model in Vancouver, Canada. The Tesla owner had claimed that his car shut down after an error notification, following which it started filling up with toxic smoke. He had to break the car window to escape as the door did not open.

224.title: Husband of teacher killed in US school shooting dies while preparing for her funeral
224.article_body: The husband of a fourth grade teacher killed in the mass shooting at an elementary school in US' Texas has died from a heart attack, family members told the New York Times. Joe Garcia was preparing for the funeral of Irma Garcia, his wife of 24 years, when he collapsed and died. The two reportedly leave behind four children.

225.title: Afghan man with medicines worth ₹64 lakh detained at Delhi airport
225.article_body: An Afghan national was detained by Central Industrial Security Force at the Indira Gandhi International Airport for carrying tablets worth ₹64.40 lakh in an alleged unauthorised manner. "The passenger couldn't produce supporting documents or a medical prescription for carrying such a huge quantity of medicine," a CISF officer said. The medicines are understood to be used for treating brain tumour.

226.title: MCD issues helpline to counter misconception about demolition drives
226.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) on Thursday issued a helpline number (8588813545) to help counter "misconception" about its demolition drives. A public notice issued in this regard said a "misleading campaign" has been launched recently stating MCD will demolish buildings and shops in unauthorised colonies. "It's hereby clarified that MCD has no such plans," the notice said.

227.title: India not planning to curb rice exports, has sufficient stocks: Report
227.article_body: India, the world's top rice exporter, is reportedly not planning to curb exports of rice as it has sufficient stocks and local rates are lower than state-set support prices. "There's no concern at all in terms of either prices...or availability for exports and domestic requirements," a government official told Reuters. This comes after India banned wheat exports on May 14.

228.title: India will get criticised for choosing self-reliance, so be it: Adani
228.article_body: India's richest person Gautam Adani, in a post he shared on LinkedIn, said India is right to focus on self-reliance and must go through the process even if there is pushback. "Many will try to stop us from building semiconductor plants...from investing a larger portion of our GDP in defence...So be it," he wrote, while calling global cooperation a "facade".

229.title: CBI arrests businessman Avinash Bhosale in Yes Bank-DHFL case
229.article_body: The CBI on Thursday arrested Pune-based real estate group ABIL's Chairman Avinash Bhosale in the Yes Bank-Dewan Housing Finance Corporation (DHFL) fraud case. The arrest comes nearly a month after CBI conducted raids on the premises of Bhosale and two other builders Vinod Goenka and Shahid Balwa. As per CBI, illicit funds were allegedly routed through several real estate companies.

230.title: Car tech firm ECARX to go public in China's largest US listing since DiDi
230.article_body: Chinese auto tech startup ECARX, backed by billionaire Li Shufu, on Thursday said it will go public through a merger with blank-check company COVA Acquisition Corp in a deal that values it at $3.82 billion. As per Bloomberg, this will be the largest Chinese listing in the US since DiDi Global Inc. ECARX develops software and hardware systems for cars.

231.title: ABB acquires 72% stake in Bengaluru-based EV startup Numocity
231.article_body: Swiss technology company ABB on Thursday announced that its e-mobility division has agreed to acquire a controlling stake in Bengaluru-based electric vehicle (EV) charging solutions startup Numocity. With this, ABB's shareholding in Numocity will increase to 72% from 7% earlier, and it will gain the right to become its sole owner by 2026. The acquisition cost wasn't disclosed.

232.title: Velocity to face Supernovas in Women's T20 Challenge final despite loss vs Trailblazers
232.article_body: Smriti Mandhana-led Trailblazers defeated Deepti Sharma-led Velocity by 16 runs in the last league stage match of Women's T20 Challenge. Despite the win, Trailblazers failed to qualify for the final. Supernovas finished on top of the points table, while Velocity finished second having a better net run-rate than Trailblazers. Supernovas will face Velocity in the final on Saturday.

233.title: Centre to hold meeting with Flipkart, Amazon over fake reviews
233.article_body: The Consumer Affairs Ministry will hold a virtual meeting on Friday with stakeholders, including e-commerce entities like Flipkart, Amazon and Reliance Retail, to discuss the magnitude of fake reviews on their platforms. The ministry said fake and misleading reviews violate a consumer's right to information. The meeting will discuss possible measures to prevent such anomalies, it added.

234.title: I've asked ministers not to use red beacons atop their cars: WB CM
234.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that she has asked the state Cabinet ministers not to use red beacons atop their cars while travelling. Speaking during a felicitation ceremony of Kolkata Police, Banerjee said, "Even the police use red beacons for smooth movement." She added, "All of this is not appreciated by people, they don't like this."

235.title: India will help Sri Lanka in economic recovery: PM Modi in Chennai
235.article_body: Speaking during his Chennai visit, PM Narendra Modi assured that India will support Sri Lanka's democracy, stability and economic recovery. "India is providing all possible support to Sri Lanka. This includes financial support, fuel, food, medicine and other essential items," he said. He noted that many Indian organisations and individuals have sent assistance to the people of Sri Lanka.

236.title: Pakistan govt raises petrol price by PKR 30 per litre, new rate effective from midnight
236.article_body: Pakistan government on Thursday announced it has decided to raise prices of petrol by PKR 30 per litre, with the hike set to go into effect at midnight tonight, Dawn reported. The announcement was made at a press conference in Islamabad. This comes a day after the government and the IMF failed to reach an agreement on an economic bailout.

237.title: 2020 saw over 18% lesser road accidents, 12% lesser deaths: Report
237.article_body: A report released by the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) stated that the number of road accidents saw nearly 18.46% decline in 2020, as compared to 2019. It further stated that the number of people who died in road accidents also saw a decline by 12.84%. Over 3.66 lakh road accidents were reported in 2020, the report stated.

238.title: Dr Ambedkar's statue vandalised in Uttar Pradesh's Mahoba
238.article_body: Police said that a statue of Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar was allegedly vandalised by unidentified people in Panwari town of Uttar Pradesh's Mahoba. "Unidentified miscreants damaged the statue installed at the Mela Ground on Wednesday night," Circle Officer Umesh Chandra said. BSP members, led by district president Gangadeen, staged a protest against the incident and demanded the restoration of the statue.

239.title: Actor Kevin Spacey charged with sexual assault against three men
239.article_body: Kevin Spacey has been charged in the UK with four counts of sexual assault against three men. Spacey "has also been charged with causing a person to engage in penetrative sexual activity without consent". While charges were authorised on Thursday, Spacey isn't currently in England or Wales and charges can't formally be applied until he enters one of those countries.

240.title: Congress workers protest against vandalism of Nehru statue in MP
240.article_body: Congress workers staged a protest after some miscreants allegedly damaged the statue of former PM Jawaharlal Nehru in Madhya Pradesh's Satna. "The incident took place on Tuesday, some BJP workers vandalised the statue of Jawaharlal Nehru. We demand the immediate arrest of the accused (by) the administration," a Congress worker said. The police have taken six people into custody.

241.title: Assam CM spews hate to make RSS happy: AIUDF MLA on madrasa remark
241.article_body: All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) MLA Rafiqul Islam criticised Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma over his madrasa remark and said that the latter "spews hate to make RSS happy". "He must know students from madrasas are becoming doctors and engineers," Rafiqul Islam said. Earlier, the Assam CM said madrasas should cease to exist.

242.title: BJP using CBI to scare opposition: Congress leader after CBI raids
242.article_body: After the CBI conducted raids at Ranchi residences of former state minister and Congress leader Bandhu Tirkey, he criticised the BJP and accused the party of using CBI. "Whenever there are polls in state, this happens...If we oppose wrongful BJP policies, they scare non-BJP members using CBI," Tirkey said. Tirkey was raided in connection with 34th National Games scam.

243.title: No intention of building military base in Solomon Islands: China
243.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi has said that China, which signed a security pact with Solomon Islands last month, has no intention of building military base there. "[The security pact] isn't imposed on anyone, nor...targeted at any third party," Yi said. US, Australia and New Zealand had voiced concerns over possible Chinese military presence in Solomon Islands due to pact.

244.title: Lithuanian parliament accepts draft bill on same-sex unions
244.article_body: Lithuanian parliament on Thursday voted to accept a draft bill on legalising same-sex unions, enlisting it for further debate. As many as 70 lawmakers voted in favour of draft bill, which "regulates...principles of monogamy, voluntariness, equality [and] legitimate expectations," a lawmaker said. The bill will now move to parliament committees before returning for a second plenary vote in June.

245.title: IAS couple who used Delhi stadium to walk their dog transferred to Ladakh, Arunachal
245.article_body: IAS officer couple Sanjeev Khirwar and Rinku Dugga have been transferred to Ladakh and Arunachal Pradesh, respectively, after being accused of using Delhi government-run Thyagraj Stadium for walking their dog. Athletes and coaches had complained about being forced to wrap training by 7 pm and empty the stadium so that Delhi's Principal Secretary (Revenue) Khirwar could walk his pet.

246.title: PM to inaugurate India's biggest drone festival in Delhi tomorrow
246.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate India's biggest drone festival, the Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022, at Pragati Maidan in Delhi on Friday. He said this forum brings together key stakeholders including startups with the aim of increasing India's presence in the sector. "I'd urge all those interested in tech and innovation to watch the programme," PM Modi added.

247.title: Earthquake of magnitude 7.2 hits Peru, no casualties reported
247.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 7.2 hit the Tirapata region of southern Peru on Thursday, the US Geological Survey (USGS) said. Meanwhile, the US Tsunami Warning System said there was no tsunami warning in place, adding that there were no early reports of damage or casualties. Reportedly, the earthquake was also felt in the southern regions of Arequipa, Cusco and Tacna.

248.title: IAS couple who used Delhi stadium to walk their dog transferred to different states
248.article_body: IAS officer couple Sanjeev Khirwar and Rinku Dugga have been transferred to Ladakh and Arunachal Pradesh, respectively, after being accused of using Delhi government-run Thyagraj Stadium for walking their dog. Athletes and coaches had complained about being forced to wrap training by 7 pm and empty the stadium so that Delhi's Principal Secretary (Revenue) Khirwar could walk his pet.

249.title: Don't touch me, you're untouchable: Religious preacher to man touching his feet on video
249.article_body: A video showing religious preacher Dhirendra Krishna Shastri calling a man "untouchable" is being widely shared on social media. The video shows the man trying to touch the preacher's feet on stage, following which Dhirendra Krishna Shastri says, "Don't touch me. You are untouchable." Several organisations, including Tribal Army and The Dalit Voice, have called for his arrest.

250.title: Johnny Depp's alleged text message about Amber Heard & Elon Musk's affair surfaces
250.article_body: In a text allegedly sent in 2016, Johnny Depp said Amber Heard was "begging for global humiliation" and "she's gonna get it". Depp talked about the alleged affair between Heard and Elon Musk and called Heard a "gold digging, low level...dangling overused flappy fish market." "Come see me face to face...I'll show him things he's never seen before," it read.

251.title: Pakistan's National Assembly approves bill to stop use of EVMs
251.article_body: Pakistan's National Assembly on Thursday approved a bill that seeks to stop the use of electronic voting machines (EVMs) in general elections as well as disallow overseas citizens from voting in polls. The Elections (Amendment) Bill 2022 is expected to be sent to Senate on Friday, local media reported. Notably, these reforms were brought in by ex-PM Imran Khan's government.

252.title: We feel for you: Prince Charles as he meets Ukrainian refugees
252.article_body: Britain's Prince Charles on Wednesday travelled to Romania's capital Bucharest to meet the Ukrainian refugees who fled their country since Russia began its invasion in February. Speaking to a group of Ukrainians through an interpreter, Charles said, "We feel for you greatly, it's a nightmare situation. I'm full of admiration for the Ukrainian people. Total, extraordinary courage and resilience."

253.title: Authorities in US' California on high alert after Texas school attack
253.article_body: Authorities in US' Southern California are on high alert after 21 people, including 19 students, were killed in a school shooting in Texas earlier this week. Police departments of some cities in Los Angeles County, including Arcadia, have said they will increase patrols around local schools to ensure the safety of children. The suspected attacker was shot dead by police.

254.title: Govt committed to popularise Tamil language, culture: PM in Chennai
254.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said the Government of India is fully committed to further popularising the Tamil language and culture. "In January this year, the new campus of the Central Institute of Classical Tamil was inaugurated in Chennai," he added. Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin urged PM Modi to make Tamil an official language like Hindi.

255.title: Spain reports 25 new cases of monkeypox, country's tally rises to 84
255.article_body: Spanish Health Ministry reported 25 new cases of monkeypox on Thursday, taking the total number of infections in the country to 84. The Health Ministry also added that there are 73 suspected cases of monkeypox in the country. Meanwhile, Spain's neighbour Portugal reported nine new cases of the viral disease on Thursday, bringing the total number of infections to 58.

256.title: 7-year-old captured leopard burnt alive in Uttarakhand; FIR filed against 150 people
256.article_body: A seven-year-old male leopard captured by the Uttarakhand forest department was burnt alive by a mob in a village in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal district on Tuesday. Officials said that the locals were angry over the death of a woman, who was mauled by a leopard earlier this month. An FIR has been registered against the village's pradhan and 149 others.

257.title: Ola Electric scooter's front suspension broke while riding, claims man; shares pic
257.article_body: A man has tweeted a photo of his broken Ola Electric scooter, claiming the front suspension broke during low-speed driving. "We'd like to request that we need a replacement or design change...and save our life from...road accident due to poor material used," the Twitter user wrote. The photo shows the front tyre of the electric scooter had come off.

258.title: Key accused in last month's Sunjwan attack in J&K arrested
258.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested a key accused in connection with a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Sunjwan in which a Central Industrial Security Force official was martyred and two Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists were killed. NIA said the accused is an overground worker of Jaish-e-Mohammed. He was in touch with Pakistan-based handlers of the banned terror outfit.

259.title: ONGC to sell stake, seeks global help to develop fields
259.article_body: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) is offering a stake to global oil companies to enlist their help in developing challenging fields in India, according to a tender document. ONGC didn't disclose the size of the stake it's selling. It aims to develop the Deen Dayal West field in Bay of Bengal and the ultra-deep discoveries in Krishna Godavari Basin.

260.title: Can't stop change at national level: KCR after PM's 'pariwarwaad' remark
260.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said on Thursday that there will soon be a change in politics at the national level which no one can stop. "Tribals, farmers and the poor aren't happy in the country. Industries are getting closed," he added. Notably, his remarks come hours after PM Narendra Modi criticised 'pariwarwaad' (dynastic politics) at an event in Hyderabad.

261.title: Sex work is a profession, police should treat sex workers with dignity: SC
261.article_body: The Supreme Court has said that sex work is a profession and its practitioners are entitled to dignity and equal protection of the law. "Police should treat all sex workers with dignity and shouldn't abuse them," the court stated. It also said that the government should educate sex workers about the legality of sex work and rights among other things.

262.title: Moody's cuts India's 2022 GDP forecast from 9.1% to 8.8%
262.article_body: Ratings agency Moody's Investors Service on Thursday lowered its GDP growth forecast for India for 2022 by 30 basis points from 9.1% to 8.8%. "Rise in crude oil, food and fertiliser prices will weigh on household finances and spending in the months ahead," Moody's noted in its report. It also slashed its forecast for advanced economies from 3.2% to 2.6%.

263.title: Actively hiring: Rival fintech startups as Klarna lays off 10% staff
263.article_body: Several rivals of Swedish fintech startup Klarna said they were actively hiring after the firm fired 10% of its 7,000 employees on Monday. London-based money transfer firm Wise's CEO tweeted, "Years of building Wise as a profitable long-term company is paying off now...can't hire people fast enough...385 open roles." Digital banking start-up Revolut said it's hiring for 250 roles.

264.title: Pakistan's SC dismisses contempt petition against ex-PM Imran Khan
264.article_body: Pakistan's Supreme Court has dismissed a contempt petition against ex-PM Imran Khan for "violating" its orders during the 'Azadi march'. Attorney General Ashtar Ausaf Ali, who filed the petition, said Khan "misled" the court as he initially took the permission for holding the rally at Islamabad's sector H-9, but he later announced that it'd be held at D-Chowk, Dawn reported.

265.title: Google pursuing licensing deals with Indian publishers: Pichai
265.article_body: Google is planning to strike licensing deals with publishers across the world and is working towards having discussions with Indian publishers in this context, Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai said. Terming the Indian market "incredibly important", he added, "[Google realises] the critical role news plays in India...particularly with the long heritage and the fact that it works in so many languages."

266.title: Varanasi court adjourns hearing on Gyanvapi Mosque case till May 30
266.article_body: The Varanasi district court on Thursday adjourned hearing on the Gyanvapi mosque-Kashi Vishwanath temple complex dispute till May 30. This comes after the court heard the arguments of the Muslim side, which seeks dismissal of the Hindu side's civil suit. "The Muslim side's arguments on the maintainability of the case remained incomplete today," said District Government Counsel RS Singh.

267.title: Make Tamil official language like Hindi: CM Stalin while sharing stage with PM Modi
267.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin while speaking at an event attended by PM Narendra Modi in Chennai on Thursday demanded that Tamil be made the official language like Hindi in offices of the Government of India and the Madras High Court. Stalin also urged PM Modi to exempt Tamil Nadu from the national medical entrance test NEET.

268.title: India thrash Indonesia 16-0 in men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey, qualify for Super 4s
268.article_body: India on Thursday thrashed Indonesia 16-0 in their last Pool A match in men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey. With the victory, India qualified for the Super 4s along with Japan from Pool A, while Pakistan and Indonesia finished third and fourth in the group, respectively. Dipsan Tirkey scored four goals for India, while Sudev Belimagga scored a hat-trick against Indonesia.

269.title: PM Modi holds roadshow as he arrives in Chennai; video surfaces
269.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was greeted by his supporters in Chennai on Thursday as he held a roadshow upon his arrival. He was received by Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi, ex-CM Edappadi K Palaniswami, as well as other senior DMK ministers. PM Modi, who was in Hyderabad earlier today, will lay foundation stones for multiple infrastructure projects in Tamil Nadu.

270.title: Broadcom to acquire VMware for $61 billion in one of the largest tech deals
270.article_body: Broadcom Inc. agreed to buy cloud-computing company VMware Inc. for about $61 billion in cash and stock in one of the largest technology deals of all time. VMware shareholders will elect to receive either $142.50 in cash or 0.2520 shares of Broadcom common stock for each VMware share. Broadcom will also assume $8 billion of VMware's net debt.

271.title: COVID-19 not over yet, continue wearing masks: Maharashtra CM
271.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray urged the people of the state to continue wearing masks amid the rise in COVID-19 cases. "Although the number of hospitalisation (due to COVID-19) is low, everyone should be alert and cautious as the virus has not gone away completely as yet," he said. On Wednesday, Maharashtra reported 470 COVID-19 cases, the highest since March 5.

272.title: Cong nurtured Yasin Malik: MP Minister after Malik's sentencing
272.article_body: After Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik was sentenced in a terror funding case, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra alleged that Malik was "nurtured" by the Congress. "Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, Digvijaya Singh's tweet on Yasin Malik did not come...Yasin Malik has been convicted by the court, he himself has accepted the murder on TV," Mishra said.

273.title: Waze seeks to become approver against Deshmukh in corruption case
273.article_body: Former Mumbai Police officer Sachin Waze filed an application in the Special CBI court to become an approver against former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in an alleged corruption case. The CBI has accepted his application with conditions and the court will hear the case on May 30. Waze and Deshmukh are currently in jail under various charges.

274.title: PM Modi inaugurates 11 projects worth ₹31,000 crore in Tamil Nadu
274.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid the foundation stone of 11 projects, including a 262-km-long Bengaluru-Chennai Expressway, worth over ₹31,000 crore in Tamil Nadu on Thursday. The projects also include the redevelopment of five railway stations in the state. CM MK Stalin was also present during the event at the Jawaharlal Nehru Indoor Stadium in Chennai.

275.title: Girl tells Chhattisgarh CM she can't afford studies, he sanctions ₹3 lakh
275.article_body: During a 'Bhet Mulaqat' programme in Chhattisgarh's Chitrakoot area, a girl named Lokeshwari told CM Bhupesh Baghel that she can't study due to financial issues as her father died 15 years ago. Baghel immediately instructed the in-charge of Bastar district to sanction financial assistance of ₹3 lakh to her. A picture of the interaction between them has surfaced online.

276.title: Africa CDC warns over hoarding of vaccines amid monkeypox outbreak
276.article_body: Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention has warned against the hoarding of vaccines amid the monkeypox outbreak. Ahmed Ogwell Ouma, the Deputy Director of Africa CDC, said, "Vaccines should go...where [they're] needed the most...so based on risk and not on who can be able to buy it." Several countries, including the UK and the US, have reported monkeypox cases.

277.title: 2 members of Gogi gang detained in Delhi; guns & cartridges seized
277.article_body: Delhi Police said that they have detained two alleged members of the Gogi gang, led by slain gangster Jitender Gogi, and recovered two guns and 20 live cartridges from them. DCP (outer north) Brijendra Kumar Yadav said that the detained accused are "sharpshooters" and minors. Police added that the two allegedly planned to kill the father of gangster Neeraj Bawana.

278.title: Apple sends 36 kg repair kit to man in US to fix his iPhone 13 mini
278.article_body: The Verge's Sean Hollister revealed he recently opted to repair his iPhone 13 mini by using Apple's self-service repair programme in US. He said Apple sent him a toolkit in two suitcases weighing 79 pounds (36 kg) to fix a 1.1 ounce (0.03 kg) battery. Hollister added the entire process was full of challenges and the manual wasn't very helpful.

279.title: CBI arrests Customs appraiser, aide in Delhi in bribery case
279.article_body:
The CBI has arrested an appraiser of the Customs Department and his associate at the Delhi airport for allegedly seeking bribe of ₹1.40 lakh, officials said. The accused demanded the bribe from a businessman to clear a consignment of batteries to South Africa, officials added. 
CBI spokesperson said they arrested the accused while they were allegedly accepting ₹1 lakh bribe.

280.title: Death toll rises to 19 in Iran building collapse, over 35 injured
280.article_body: The death toll from the collapse of a 10-storey commercial building in Iran's Abadan city has risen to 19, a local official was quoted as saying. Meanwhile, an official said that over 35 people have been rescued from the rubble and added that they're undergoing treatment in the hospitals. Reportedly, 10 people have been arrested by police over the incident.

281.title: Won't back Sweden, Finland's NATO bids unless measures taken: Turkey
281.article_body: Turkey will not back Sweden and Finland's respective bids to join NATO unless the countries take "concrete steps" to address the former's security concerns, a senior Turkish official said on Wednesday. This comes after delegations from Sweden and Finland met Turkish officials for talks in Ankara. Turkey has accused the countries of having links with a Kurdish militant group.

282.title: IAS officer shares pic of gutkha spit inside plane; says 'someone left their identity'
282.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan shared a picture of gutkha spit next to a seat inside a plane and wrote, "Somebody left their identity." Reacting to the picture, IPS officer Suraj Singh Parihar tweeted, "Who leaves behind their upbringing, culture like this?" Meanwhile, another Twitter user wrote, "Inexcusable. He can be tracked back and punished and penalised."

283.title: Stage at Hyd airport shows PM Modi is on political visit: TRS leader
283.article_body: TRS leader Krishank Manne shared the picture of a stage set up at Hyderabad International Airport ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to the city. "This stage at the airport explains that PM isn't just on an official visit but also a political visit," Krishank said. "In that case, PM Modi should answer many pending promises of Telangana," he added.

284.title: Rape survivor tries to set herself ablaze over police inaction in UP
284.article_body: A rape survivor attempted to set herself on fire outside a police station in UP's Baghpat after being upset over police inaction in her case. The woman alleged that her in-laws used to harass her for dowry and that her husband's brother raped her and shot a video to blackmail her. It's also alleged she was gangraped by four men.

285.title: 4 tourists arrested for offering prayers on Taj Mahal premises
285.article_body: At least four tourists were arrested for offering prayers at the Shahi mosque on Taj Mahal premises, police said on Thursday. The individuals, who hail from Hyderabad and Azamgarh, were booked under section 153 of the IPC, which punishes "provoking with intent to cause riots". Offering 'namaz' inside the monument's premises is only permitted on Friday, an ASI official said.

286.title: Delhi woman plans own kidnapping to extort money from brother; held
286.article_body: A 38-year-old woman has been arrested for allegedly plotting her own kidnapping to extort money from her brother, Delhi Police said on Thursday. The woman converted her voice to sound like a man using an app and sent it to her brother for ransom. She also sent pictures to her brother showing her gagged with her hands tied.

287.title: Excellent meet: British High Commissioner after meeting Punjab CM
287.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann met the British High Commissioner to India, Alex Ellis, at his residence in Chandigarh on Thursday. Informing about the meeting, CM Mann said, "Discussed the prospects of partnership in education, IT and various other sectors." Meanwhile, Ellis tweeted, "Excellent first meeting with...CM Bhagwant Mann. Discussed opportunities on Punjab-UK flights, sports [and] trade."

288.title: Shell in talks with Indian consortium to sell Russian LNG plant stake: Report
288.article_body: Shell is in talks with a consortium of Indian energy companies, including ONGC Videsh and GAIL, to sell its 27.5% stake in Russia's Sakhalin-2 LNG plant, Reuters reported. Shell had said in February that it'd shut down all its operations in Russia. It's also asking the Indian consortium for separate bids for long-term LNG supply deals it has with Sakhalin-2.

289.title: People in courtroom laugh as judge jokingly calls Depp's lawyer a 'snarky guy'
289.article_body: The judge jokingly called Johnny Depp's attorney a "snarky guy" as the whole courtroom burst into laughter. The moment came at the end of hearing an emergency motion to intervene filed by TMZ. Depp's lawyer previously said TMZ wasn't comparable to major news outlets and noted he wasn't trying to be "snarky", following which the judge said, "You're just...a...snarky guy."

290.title: Train arrives 20 minutes early in MP; video shows passengers doing garba to celebrate
290.article_body: A video is going viral on social media, showing train passengers performing garba at Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam railway platform after their train reportedly arrived 20 minutes earlier than scheduled on Wednesday. Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw also shared the video and tweeted, "Majama! Happy Journey." It was a Bandra-Haridwar train that reportedly had a stop time of 10 minutes.

291.title: India has never been a large importer of Russian oil: Piyush Goyal
291.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal, while speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, said that India has never been a very large importer of petroleum products from Russia. "India always looked at diversified sources for our petroleum requirements," Goyal stated. He added that any suggestion that India is increasing imports from Russia doesn't stand scrutiny.

292.title: After 2014, India is witnessing political willpower & reforms: PM
292.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking in Hyderabad on Thursday said, "If we compare last eight years with the previous three decades, we'll see that reforms couldn't take place...due to a lack of political willpower and instability." "After 2014, India is witnessing political willpower and reforms," he said. PM Modi participated in the 20th-anniversary celebrations of the Indian School of Business.

293.title: Pune police official's son killed; college friend & husband booked
293.article_body: A police official's son was allegedly murdered by his college friend and her husband in Pune's Hadapsar area on Tuesday night. According to the police, the 21-year-old victim was attacked by the woman, her husband and three other people, all of whom have been booked under murder charges. The husband was reportedly unhappy about his wife's friendship with the victim.

294.title: Vedanta to finalise location of $20 bn semiconductor plant by June
294.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal told Reuters that the company will finalise a location for its $20 billion semiconductor and display plants in India by mid-June. "You have to create another Taiwan in India," Agarwal said, adding that Vedanta's first chip product will be ready in two years. Taiwan's Foxconn will have technical responsibility for the operation, he added.

295.title: Cong's Harish Rawat sits on protest on U'khand highway; video surfaces
295.article_body: Former Uttarakhand Chief Minister and Congress leader Harish Rawat staged a sit-in protest at the Haldwani highway in the state to highlight the condition of the road. In a video shared by his office, the Congress leader is seen sitting near a pothole. Rawat said he was ready to be arrested for protesting over the issue.

296.title: India providing critical humanitarian aid to Afghanistan: US praises India
296.article_body: US Special Envoy for Afghanistan Thomas West on Thursday praised India for supporting Afghanistan's public. "India is providing critical humanitarian aid, has interests to protect, brings enormous capability and experience to supporting Afghan people," the US envoy tweeted. India has supplied tonnes of wheat, winter clothing, essential medications and doses of Covaxin to Afghanistan.

297.title: 7 yrs worth of foreign portfolio investments wiped out in 8 months
297.article_body: Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) have net sold Indian stocks worth ₹2.5 lakh crore since October 2021, as per data available on National Securities Depository Limited (NSDL). This is more than the net investment of ₹2.2 lakh crore made by FPIs between 2014 and 2020, data showed. Meanwhile, domestic retail investors net invested ₹2.1 lakh crore in 2021 and 2022.

298.title: 31 arrested, 4 women rescued after raid at dance bar in Mumbai
298.article_body: At least 31 persons were arrested and four women were rescued after the police and the social service branch conducted a raid at Pushpak Bar in Mumbai's Kalina area. During the raid, eight women were found on the premises, despite the owner having permission to employ only four women. The police arrested 21 patrons and 11 employees of the bar.

299.title: WB to move bill to appoint CM as chancellor of state universities instead of Guv
299.article_body: The West Bengal Cabinet has decided to introduce a bill to appoint Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee as the chancellor of all state universities instead of Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar. This comes amid a frequent war of words between Dhankhar and Banerjee. State Minister Bratya Basu said this will be taken to the Assembly for the Act to be amended.

300.title: Yasin Malik won't be given any work in Tihar, will be alone in jail no. 7: Officials
300.article_body: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik will not be assigned any work at Tihar jail due to security reasons, will be lodged alone inside jail number 7 and will not be entitled to any parole or furlough during his prison term, officials said. "Malik's security will be routinely monitored by the Intelligence Bureau besides jail officers," a prison officer added.

301.title: Putin will not dictate Ukraine peace terms: German Chancellor
301.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said that Russian President Vladimir Putin would not dictate the terms of any peace agreement, "Ukraine will not accept that, and neither will we". "A capture of the whole of Ukraine seems further away now than at the beginning of the war," Scholz added, saying he is "convinced" that Putin will not win the Ukraine war.

302.title: Dhoni is 1 in a billion product, has mind like 5-star General: Ex-trainer
302.article_body: Talking about MS Dhoni, ex-India trainer Ramji Srinivasan said, "MSD is an enigma and like Sachin Tendulkar, is one in a billion product." "He has amazing [reflexes] like a...[F1] driver and...mind like [a] 5-star General," added Srinivasan. "Very few can match [his] fitness...[at] that age," he stated. "Dhoni does what suits him, be it strength work...or hybrid work," said Srinivasan.

303.title: There’s no comparison, we are all one industry: Raveena on north-south debate
303.article_body: Speaking about the north-south debate, actress Raveena Tandon said that all this chatter is "overhyped" about what is right and wrong with which industry. "Even 'KGF' and 'RRR' are ballpark figures. When you compare two Hindi films' business only, our films have also done that well," she added. Raveena said there is no comparison as they are all one industry.

304.title: He created a problem straightaway at Man Utd: Gary Neville on Ronaldo
304.article_body: Former Manchester United player Gary Neville said Cristiano Ronaldo's arrival at Manchester United in 2021 created a problem straightaway, adding that it upset the dynamic in the dressing room for midfielder Bruno Fernandes. "[Edinson Cavani] was being pleaded to stay and lead the attack for the year, but when they signed Ronaldo, Cavani was shot then and finished," stated Neville.

305.title: 8 years of BJP govt marked by 'misery', 'misgovernance': Congress
305.article_body: Congress on Thursday criticised the BJP government ahead of its eighth anniversary alleging that this period has been marked by 'misery' and 'misgovernance'. "While high prices are upsetting the budgets of common people...on the other [hand], communal fires are flaring," said Randeep Surjewala at a press conference. Congress also released a booklet highlighting 'failures' of the BJP government.

306.title: Fill Kozhikode runway end with sand to arrest overshooting aircraft: Panel
306.article_body: A high-level committee which had been appointed to look into the Kozhikode crash that killed 21 people in August 2020 has recommended that the end of the 90-metre Runway End Safety Area (RESA) should be filled with sand or soil. The committee said that the sand or soil should have a depth of fifteen centimetres to arrest an overshooting aircraft.

307.title: Rahul didn't need political clearance for his London visit: Congress
307.article_body: Speaking on reports that Rahul Gandhi had no political clearance for London visit, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "If you are a minister or holding a public office or a government official, then you need political clearance." "Rahul as a parliamentarian only needed FCRA clearance. We still are a democratic country and don't live in stone age," Surjewala added.

308.title: It’s not possible to win polls through CBI: Jharkhand Congress chief
308.article_body: Following CBI raids at Ranchi residences of ex-Jharkhand minister and Congress leader Bandhu Tirkey, state Congress chief Rajesh Thakur said agenda behind such raids by CBI is clear. "If someone wants to win elections through CBI then it's not possible," Thakur added. "It's the people who will decide. Yesterday the polls were notified and raids were conducted today," Thakur stated.

309.title: Told her all wrong things: Neena on marriage advice she gave to daughter Masaba
309.article_body: When asked what advice she gave to her daughter Masaba Gupta about marriage and relationships, actress Neena Gupta said, "Wahi sab galat cheezein boli maine. Wahi ghise peeti baatein jo har maa bolti hai (I told her all...wrong things, the same talk mothers give to their daughters)." On the professional front, Neena was recently seen in 'Panchayat 2'.

310.title: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa probed over May 9 clashes
310.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa was probed by authorities over clashes that broke out in Colombo earlier this month amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. Rajapaksa gave a three-hour-long statement to Sri Lankan police amid allegations that his party's supporters attacked anti-government protesters on May 9. At least 10 people died and over 200 others were injured due to clashes.

311.title: It's a blessing to have her home: Nick Jonas on his daughter Malti
311.article_body: During his appearance on 'The Kelly Clarkson Show', singer Nick Jonas called his daughter a “blessing” in his life. He said, "She’s the best. It’s just been a magical season in our life. Also pretty wild, but it’s a blessing to have her home. It’s been wonderful." Actress Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas welcomed their first child, Malti, this January.

312.title: We'll come back stronger: Gautam Gambhir after LSG's exit from IPL 2022
312.article_body: After LSG lost to RCB in the IPL 2022 Eliminator, LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir said it was a "great tournament" for them and they'll come back stronger next season. The KL Rahul-led side won nine of their 14 league games to enter the playoffs but suffered defeat by 14 runs against RCB in the Eliminator on Wednesday.

313.title: Putin weaponising hunger, trying to hold world to ransom: UK
313.article_body: UK Foreign Secretary Liz Truss on Thursday said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "needs to remove the blockade on Ukrainian grain". "It is completely appalling that Putin is trying to hold the world to ransom and he is essentially weaponising hunger and lack of food amongst the poorest people around the world," she said.

314.title: He's always the favourite in French Open even if injured: Goran on Nadal
314.article_body: Former Wimbledon-winning Croatian Goran Ivanisevic said Rafael Nadal will always be the favourite in French Open even if he injured. "[Roland Garros] is his home, [Philippe-Chatrier is] his court," added Goran. "Whether he plays well or badly, under the sun or not, it changes nothing," he stated. "[Nadal] is incredible, I have enormous respect for him," said Goran.

315.title: More women should contest and win elections: President Ram Nath Kovind
315.article_body: Inaugurating National Women Legislators' Conference in Kerala on Thursday, President Ram Nath Kovind called for better participation of women in Indian politics. "There should be far more of you [women] contesting and winning the elections," he said. "They [women] have suffered from deep-rooted social prejudices. Their proportion in the workforce is nowhere near their potential," he added.

316.title: Thieves end up burning ₹19 lakh in attempt to rob ATM in Bengaluru
316.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have registered a case after some thieves ended up burning currency notes worth over ₹19 lakh in an attempt to steal money from an ATM of Canara Bank. They were reportedly trying to open the ATM with a gas cutter when the notes got burnt. The security firm responsible for managing the ATM has filed the case.

317.title: Gautam Gambhir's pic with KL Rahul after LSG's exit from IPL 2022 goes viral
317.article_body: A picture of LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir with captain KL Rahul following the team's defeat against RCB in IPL 2022 Eliminator has gone viral. "OMG the death stare," a fan commented on the picture. "GG to KL: 'kar diya Misbah wali harkat'," wrote another fan. Rahul was dismissed in the 19th over for 79(58) as LSG lost by 14 runs.

318.title: Former BJP corporator, son injured in group clash in MP's Rewa
318.article_body: A former BJP corporator, Lavkush Gupta, and his son were injured in a clash between two communities in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district on Wednesday evening. According to police, the clash erupted following an argument over a tract of land near a temple and a mosque in Malakpur area. Following the incident, heavy security has been deployed in the area.

319.title: BBMP grants more powers to zonal commissioners
319.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) issued an order giving more administrative and financial powers to zonal commissioners. As per the order, zonal commissioners' approval will be mandatory for administrative and executive works while revenue, forest, animal husbandry, infrastructure, stormwater drains, engineering, health and town planning departments will operate under their own heads.

320.title: Private university VC arrested for businessman's 'suicide' in Assam
320.article_body: A private university’s vice-chancellor (VC) was arrested in Assam in connection with the death of a businessman. Primary investigation suggests it's a case of suicide, police said. The businessman was the owner of a resort on the outskirts of Guwahati. He blamed Assam Don Bosco University’s VC, Father Stephen Mavely, for "mental harassment" which led him to take this step.

321.title: Delhi HC allows Sharjeel Imam to approach trial court for interim bail
321.article_body: Delhi HC allowed JNU research student Sharjeel Imam to approach the trial court to seek interim bail in the sedition case. The case was filed in connection with the speeches delivered by him at Jamia Millia Islamia University and Aligarh Muslim University. Sharjeel Imam had moved an application before HC citing the recent Supreme Court order on IPC Section 124A.

322.title: Don't think captaincy has anything to do with Pant's form in IPL 2022: Chawla
322.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla has said he would like to see Rishabh Pant leading DC again next IPL season as the 24-year-old is a "street-smart cricketer, who will only improve as he keeps leading". On Pant's form in IPL 2022, Chawla said, "I don't think captaincy had anything to do with his batting...I wouldn't even say that his form was bad."

323.title: 28-yr-old Indian man goes missing while on a solo trip to Azerbaijan; brother seeks help
323.article_body: A 28-year-old Indian named Manikanth Kondaveeti, on a solo trip to Azerbaijan, has gone missing. Seeking help, his brother said Manikanth hasn't been responding to their calls since May 12, adding that he was planning a hike in a forest in one of their last conversations. "Foreign ministry of India is trying its best to locate him," he stated.

324.title: Russia to expel reporters from West if YouTube blocks govt briefings
324.article_body: Russia's foreign ministry has said Western countries' reporters will be expelled from Russia if YouTube blocks access to its spokeswoman Maria Zakharova's briefings. Russia has passed a bill giving prosecutors powers to shut foreign media bureaus if a Western country has been "unfriendly" to Russian media. "We...told them: 'You block another briefing, one journalist...goes home'," Zakharova said.

325.title: You'll see me more on roads than in Raj Nivas: Newly-appointed Delhi LG
325.article_body: Soon after taking oath as 22nd Lieutenant Governor of Delhi, Vinai Kumar Saxena said that he will work as a "local guardian" in the national capital. "You'll see me more on roads than in Raj Nivas," Saxena said. "Pollution is a major issue in Delhi, will try to solve this problem...People working in unorganised sector will be trained," he added.

326.title: You shouldn't be allowed to make films: Actor Patton Oswalt on 'RRR'
326.article_body: Talking about the film 'RRR', actor Patton Oswalt tweeted, "[It's] insane. You guys are out of your [f***ing] minds." "You should not be allowed to make films," added Oswalt in his tweet. The SS Rajamouli-directorial starring Ram Charan and Jr NTR crossed the ₹1,000-crore mark globally in 16 days of its release. 'RRR' also featured Ajay Devgn and Alia Bhatt.

327.title: 10 arrested for raising anti-national slogans outside Yasin Malik's home
327.article_body: Police have arrested 10 people for allegedly raising anti-national slogans and pelting stones outside Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) chief Yasin Malik's residence in Srinagar on Wednesday before his sentencing. "The main instigators of this hooliganism will be booked," police said. "Such anti-national activities and provocative posture will always be dealt [with] strictly," they added.

328.title: Mob burns alive suspected drug dealers in a house in South Africa
328.article_body: South African police said they are on high alert after three men accused of being drug dealers were burnt alive inside a house by a mob on Tuesday afternoon. The men allegedly stabbed and injured some of the attackers while attempting to escape, but the victims were forced back to the house before it was set alight, the police added.

329.title: Axis Mutual Fund ropes in Deloitte to probe front-running scam: Report
329.article_body: Axis Mutual Fund (MF) has roped in Deloitte as a second investigator to probe the front-running scam at the firm, Times Now reported citing The Economic Times. Alvarez and Marsal is already involved in the investigation. This comes after market regulator SEBI had reportedly asked Axis MF to pin down the precise modus operandi in the case.

330.title: I get to do what B'wood hero does everyday: Dilip on playing Jethalal for 14 yrs
330.article_body: When asked if he had any hint that playing 'Jethalal' was going to be quite a long journey, actor Dilip Joshi said, "Honestly...I enjoy playing Jetha even today as an actor...I am doing everything a Hindi film hero gets to do, every day." "We have celebrated each festival and occasion with so much zest on the show," he added.

331.title: Realised needs are more important than acting, did odd jobs: Panchayat actor
331.article_body: 'Panchayat' actor Faisal Malik said that when he came to Mumbai to become an actor, he realised that meeting basic needs is more important than acting. "I started doing odd jobs at production houses...From putting tapes into cameras to managing floor...and other odd jobs, I have done it all. Whatever I know today, I learnt while working here," he added.

332.title: Putin hikes Russians' pensions, downplays impact of Ukraine op
332.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered a 10% hike in citizens' pensions and the minimum wage amid inflation. He admitted that 2022 would be a difficult year for Russia's economy but said all the difficulties were not related to the military operation in Ukraine. He added that inflation in North America and Europe was comparable and "even more" than Russia.

333.title: BJP ministers to visit over 140 constituencies the party lost in 2019
333.article_body: In order to step up preparations for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Wednesday asked its ministers to visit over 140 constituencies across the country, where the party lost in 2019. The ministers will visit the constituencies from May 25 to July 31 and interact with party workers and beneficiaries of government welfare schemes.

334.title: Man molests minor niece in Mumbai, threatens to kill her brother
334.article_body: A 34-year-old man has been booked for allegedly molesting his 13-year-old niece in Mumbai, an official said on Wednesday. The accused also threatened to kill the girl's 10-year-old brother, who was playing outside their residence, when she resisted the assault and tried to raise an alarm. The girl's parents were away for some work when the incident took place.

335.title: Will abolish minority reservations if BJP comes to power in T'gana: Sanjay Kumar
335.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party's Telangana President and MP Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Wednesday said if his party comes to power in the state, the reservations for minorities will be abolished. The benefit would be provided to the Scheduled Castes (SCs), Scheduled Tribes (STs) and the poor among upper castes, he added. He also vowed to work against religious conversions in Telangana.

336.title: Accident at Iran's sensitive military site kills engineer
336.article_body: An engineer died after an unexplained accident on Wednesday in a research centre at the Parchin military site affiliated with Iran's Defence Ministry, the semi-official Fars news agency reported. Parchin is a sensitive military site housing many industrial and research units, where Western security services suspect Iran conducted tests related to nuclear bomb detonations over a decade ago.

337.title: Mangalore University students protest against Muslim girls wearing hijab
337.article_body: Students of Mangalore University sat on protest against Muslim girls who came to the classroom wearing hijab. The students demanded that the girl students who were wearing hijab should not be allowed inside the college. They sat on protest outside the college campus and reportedly said that the girls must follow High Court's order and remove their hijab.

338.title: Interest rate hikes likely to not cause prolonged stress: Axis Bank CEO
338.article_body: Some stress will be built in the system due to interest rate hikes, but it will likely not be prolonged, said Axis Bank MD and CEO Amitabh Chaudhry. "When you look at larger banks and large institutions, people have beefed up their balance sheet in a very significant manner," Chaudhry said. "I'm not anticipating any large NPA problems," he added.

339.title: Video of Johnny Depp smiling after his ex-girlfriend Kate Moss testified goes viral
339.article_body: Viewers noticed Johnny Depp smiling as Kate Moss testified in his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. Moss testified via video link, during which she denied Heard's claim that Depp pushed her down the stairs. The model, who dated Depp between 1994 and 1998, said she did fall down a staircase and he had helped her up at the time.

340.title: Fire breaks out at scrap godown in Gurugram; 5 fire tenders at spot
340.article_body: A fire broke out in a scrap godown located in Sector 17-18 in Gurugram on Thursday afternoon, ANI reported. Sudhir Singh, a Fire Department official, said that five fire tenders reached the spot to douse the blaze and added that no casualties have been reported so far. The cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained.

341.title: 'Pariwarwaad' is democracy's biggest enemy: PM Modi in Hyderabad
341.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday criticised 'pariwarwaad' (dynastic politics) while addressing an event in Hyderabad, claiming that it's not just a political problem but rather a democracy's biggest enemy. He added that BJP wants to develop the state as a technology hub, stating that "change in Telangana is certain". Telangana will head to the polls next year.

342.title: Kohli imitates WWE gesture as policeman carries pitch invader on shoulders, video viral
342.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Virat Kohli imitating WWE gesture after a policeman carried a pitch invader on shoulders to escort him out of the ground. The fan had entered the ground during the last over of LSG's innings in the IPL 2022 Eliminator against RCB at Eden Gardens. Kohli was fielding in the deep when the incident happened.

343.title: India moving forward with dream of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat': PM in Hyd
343.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking in Hyderabad on Thursday said the 21st century India is moving forward with the dream of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat' and 'Make in India'. "Our startups are leaving an impression on the world. Today, we're the world's third-largest startup ecosystem," he added. PM Modi participated in the 20th-anniversary celebrations and graduation programme of Indian School of Business.

344.title: 7-8 feared dead after vehicle falls into deep gorge in J&K at Zojila Pass
344.article_body: Around seven-eight people are feared to have died after a vehicle fell into a deep gorge at Zojila Pass, the Disaster Management Authority of the Jammu and Kashmir government said. The vehicle, on its way from Kargil to Srinagar, reportedly skidded off the road and fell around 400-500 feet down, it added. Police are ascertaining the cause of the incident.

345.title: Apple to keep iPhone production flat in 2022: Report
345.article_body: Apple is planning to keep iPhone production roughly flat at about 220 million units in 2022, Reuters reported citing Bloomberg on Thursday. This comes as China's COVID-19 curbs, supply chain issues and cooling demand continue to hurt smartphone makers. Apple said that any new lockdowns in China and Taiwan could bring new supply and demand-related obstacles.

346.title: 10 arrested for stone pelting outside Yasin Malik's house in J&K
346.article_body: J&K Police have arrested 10 people for stone pelting and anti-national sloganeering outside separatist leader Yasin Malik's house in Srinagar.
