Several supporters of Malik clashed with security personnel and pelted stones during the protests, which were held prior to his sentencing. Malik has been sentenced to life imprisonment in the 2017 terror funding case by an NIA court in Delhi.

347.title: Sidhu's 7-meal diet plan in jail surfaces; sauteed vegetables, tofu, lassi included
347.article_body: A panel of doctors has prepared a seven-meal diet plan for cricketer-turned-politician Navjot Singh Sidhu, who is serving a year-long jail sentence in a road rage case involving a man's death. Lactose-free milk, avocado, paneer, fruits, sauteed vegetables, tofu and lassi are some of the items on his plan. A jails department official called the plan a "seven-star hotel menu".

348.title: Best innings by an uncapped player that I've seen: Karthik on Patidar's 112*(54)
348.article_body: RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik praised teammate Rajat Patidar for his unbeaten 112-run innings against LSG, stating that it was probably the best innings by an uncapped player that he has ever seen. "He's very cool, very calm, very shy personality actually, very quiet person," added Karthik. Patidar's knock helped RCB post 207/4 in the game.

349.title: NCP office-bearer allegedly attacked by BJP member in Pune
349.article_body: NCP office-bearer Appa Jadhav was attacked at his office allegedly by former BJP member Santosh Kamble and others at Narayan Peth in Pune on Wednesday. Kamble and his associates have been booked on charges of rioting. Kamble is a former office-bearer of the BJP but he doesn't hold any post in the party at present.

350.title: Unacademy CEO tells staff funding could dry up for 18 months: Report
350.article_body: Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal in an email to employees said the startup is "looking at a time where funding will dry up for at least 12-18 months. Some...are predicting that this might last 24 months," media reports said. "This is a test for all of us...We must focus on profitability at all costs. We must survive the winter," he added.

351.title: Marcos Jr proclaimed next President of Philippines by Congress
351.article_body: Ferdinand Marcos Jr, son of the former dictator, was proclaimed the next President of the Philippines by Congress on Wednesday. Sara Duterte, daughter of the outgoing President Rodrigo Duterte, was declared as the Vice President. Marcos Jr had won the presidential election by a huge margin, bagging about double the number of votes his rival secured.

352.title: Lot of people haven't appreciated me, thought I'm a bully: Urvashi Dholakia
352.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia said a lot of people haven't appreciated her. "[A lot] of people find me to be...strong-headed, like a bully. But I'm not. I have just been a woman who has her own opinions," she added. "I've been like this since I was a kid. Whether you like it or you don't, that's not my problem," Urvashi said.

353.title: Delhi Police's 'Book your space. Possession soon' ad for criminals goes viral
353.article_body: Delhi Police has released a 'room vacant' ad for criminals and wrote, "'Book' your space. Possession soon. The living offer you certainly CAN resist!" It mentioned facilities like free beds and meals, bathrooms on sharing basis and fully CCTV campus among others. "Well-ventilated (you can actually wave at the other occupants)," the ad read.

354.title: Lido Learning's 1,200 workers who were told to resign yet to receive Jan salary: Report
354.article_body: Edtech startup Lido Learning is yet to pay salaries for January to over 1,200 employees who were asked to resign abruptly in February first week, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. Earlier this month, employees received 'full and final settlement' letter from Lido Learning, however, they haven't received anything yet. The employees were asked to resign over video call, citing funding crunch.

355.title: Dibakar said 'We'll put false negative stories, that gets more eyeballs': Abhay
355.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol said that filmmaker Dibakar Banerjee told him that some false negative stories will deliberately be put out because that gets more eyeballs. "They got a journalist who I had a contentious relationship with...so he put negative stories about me only...So, I got very upset with Dibakar...and now those stories are out and they're completely false," Abhay added.

356.title: Injuries to Washington, Natarajan threw us off: SRH coach Moody
356.article_body: SRH head coach Tom Moody has said injuries to Washington Sundar and T Natarajan threw them off and made it difficult to "recapture the winning momentum" in IPL 2022. SRH started the season with two defeats before going on a five-match winning streak. However, they then lost five games in a row to subsequently finish eighth on the points table.

357.title: Central probe agencies shouldn't misuse powers: Ajit Pawar
357.article_body: Central investigation agencies have the right to search and raid but they should not "misuse powers", Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. His comment came in reaction to the ED raids at locations linked to Maharashtra Transport Minister Anil Parab. "All I want to say is that action should be held in a transparent manner," Pawar added.

358.title: What are the major announcements made in Uttar Pradesh Budget 2022-23?
358.article_body: Presenting Uttar Pradesh Budget 2022-23, state Finance Minister Suresh Kumar Khanna said the target is to make UP's economy $1 trillion in size. The old-age pension in UP has been increased from ₹500 to ₹1,000. UP has set aside ₹720 crore for women's safety projects. UP has allocated ₹560 crore for Ayushman Cards and ₹2,100 crore for 14 medical colleges.

359.title: Conspiracy to defame state govt: Raut on ED raids linked to Maha minister
359.article_body: Following raids conducted by ED at locations linked to Maharashtra Transport Minister and Shiv Sena leader Anil Parab, party leader Sanjay Raut said that BJP is using the central government agencies against the Opposition. "We are in support of Anil Parab…This is just a conspiracy to defame the Maharashtra government," Raut added.

360.title: B'luru to get IKEA store in June, K'taka CM invited for inauguration
360.article_body: Swedish furniture retailer IKEA will inaugurate its first store in Bengaluru in June with an investment of ₹1,000 crore. The store will be inaugurated in Bengaluru's Nagasandra area by the Ingka Group's CEO, Jesper Brodin, who has also invited Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai for the event. The Bengaluru store would be IKEA's third store in India after Mumbai and Hyderabad.

361.title: Shameful: Union Min on Delhi stadium being vacated for IAS officer's walk with dog
361.article_body: After reports that athletes and coaches practising at Delhi's Thyagraj Stadium were forced to wrap training by 7 pm so that Delhi's Principal Secretary (Revenue) Sanjeev Khirwar can walk his dog, Union Minister Kaushal Kishore criticised Khirwar and called the act "misuse of authority". "It's shameful that sportspersons have to empty stadium premises...The officer should apologise," Kishore said.

362.title: Pune civic body cancels planned water cut in view of President's visit
362.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to cancel the planned water cut on Thursday in view of President Ram Nath Kovind's visit to the city. Earlier, the civic body had announced that several parts of the city will not receive water due to repair work on Thursday. The areas that were to be affected included Shivajinagar and Cantonment.

363.title: Karti Chidambaram granted protection from arrest in visa scam case
363.article_body: A Delhi court has granted interim protection from arrest till May 30 to Congress MP Karti Chidambaram in the alleged money laundering case registered by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with the bribe-for-visa case. Chidambaram is accused of receiving ₹50 lakh as bribe for re-issuance of project visas for 263 Chinese nationals. He has denied all allegations levelled against him.

364.title: Crocodiles in South Africa are losing teeth to lead poisoning: Study
364.article_body: A study of Nile crocodiles in South Africa's St Lucia Lake found that lead poisoning caused due to lead-based fishing weights is making reptiles lose their teeth. Massively high lead levels were found in their blood. The lead poisoning occurred when reptiles scooped up stones from lake's floor to help them with digestion causing anaemia and fragmented teeth, study stated.

365.title: El Salvador extends anti-gang emergency for 30 more days
365.article_body: The anti-gang emergency in El Salvador will continue for 30 more days as the Congress approved an extension sought by President Nayib Bukele. The emergency was first declared in March in view of the rise in gang killings. "We are going to continue to confront this cancer…this war will continue until the gangs are eradicated," said Security Minister Gustavo Villatoro.

366.title: What multiple records did RCB's Patidar break with his 112*(54) in IPL 2022 Eliminator?
366.article_body: RCB batter Rajat Patidar became the first uncapped player in IPL history to smash a century in playoffs. He reached his hundred off 49 deliveries, the fastest hundred of IPL 2022. Patidar's 112*(54) is the third-highest score by an uncapped player in IPL history. Patidar is also the first RCB cricketer to hit a hundred in IPL playoffs.

367.title: Was rushed to hospital after 'Elvis', body started shutting down: Austin Butler
367.article_body: Actor Austin Butler said that he was rushed to the hospital the day after he finished shooting for his upcoming movie 'Elvis'. "I woke up at 4 in the morning with excruciating pain...My body just started shutting down," he added. Reports said that he was diagnosed with a virus and was bedridden for a week before recovering from the illness.

368.title: Leopard suspected to have attacked 3-yr-old boy rescued in Pune
368.article_body: Maharashtra forest department has rescued a leopard which is believed to have attacked a three-year-old boy in a village in Pune district's Shirur last week. The boy, who was attacked by the leopard in open yard near a sugarcane field, sustained injuries to his neck and chest and is undergoing treatment. The animal has been sent to a rescue centre.

369.title: 14 relatives get life term for double murder over land dispute in UP
369.article_body: A local court has sentenced 14 persons, including 3 women, to life imprisonment in a 2015 double murder case that took place in Deoria’s Mundera village in UP. All 14 persons are relatives and the court has also imposed a fine on them. "The murders were a fallout of a land dispute," District Government Counsel, Deoria, Rajesh Kumar Mishra, said.

370.title: Germany to recognise Covaxin for travel purposes from June 1
370.article_body: German Ambassador to India Walter J Lindner said Germany will start recognising Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine for travel purposes from June 1. "The embassy has been pushing very actively for such decision (because of Covid-backlogs visa sections have longer waiting periods than normal, please have patience)," Lindner added. WHO in November last year issued an Emergency Use Listing for Covaxin.

371.title: List of world's 10 best cities to work from home released
371.article_body: Singapore is the world's best city to work from home, according to a study released by mobile access technology company Kisi. It is followed by Washington, Austin, Bern, Zurich, Geneva, San Francisco, Boston, Stockholm and Liverpool. Kisi analysed data from the Journal of Public Economics and World Bank.

372.title: Be careful while downloading remote access apps: Pune Police to citizens
372.article_body: Amid rising cases of cyber frauds, Pune Police have asked people to be careful while downloading remote desktop applications like 'AnyDesk' or 'TeamViewer QuickSupport' when prompted by unknown people over phone. Fraudsters are using these applications to get confidential bank account information and transfer money to their accounts, police warned. The victims, in most cases, are senior citizens.

373.title: Harsh Vardhan walks out of Delhi L-G's oath ceremony, says 'They didn't keep seats for MPs'
373.article_body: Former Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan was seen walking out of the oath-taking ceremony of Delhi's new Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena on Thursday. "They have not kept seats for members of Parliament even," he said on being questioned why he was leaving the event. "I will write to Vinai Kumar Saxena ji," he is heard saying in video.

374.title: Rahul could've taken more chances between 9th and 13th over: Shastri
374.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri said LSG captain KL Rahul could've taken more chances to score runs between the 9th and 13th over of their game against RCB on Wednesday. "[There] should have been someone who should have been targeted...when Deepak Hooda and Rahul were going," Shastri added. RCB restricted LSG to 193/6 and won by 14 runs.

375.title: Karan Johar cuts 5-tier cake on 50th birthday, video surfaces
375.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar cut a five-tier chocolate cake on his birthday on Wednesday. A video shared online showed Karan in front of the cake with several celebrities surrounding him during the party. Several pictures from Johar's party have surfaced online. Celebrities including Aamir Khan, Hrithik Roshan, Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan attended the party.

376.title: On-screen Jaya & I were fighting; we became friends on 'Rocky...' sets: Shabana
376.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi said her equation changed with actress Jaya Bachchan on 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' sets. "Jaya Bachchan and I have known one another for ages. But somehow we never got around to being friends," she added. "On-screen, we're supposed to be fighting constantly. Once the camera was switched off, we gradually became friends," Shabana said.

377.title: ED files chargesheet against K'taka Congress chief DK Shivakumar
377.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) filed a chargesheet against Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar and others in a money laundering case on Thursday. The case pertains to a 2018 chargesheet filed by the Income Tax Department against Shivakumar and others for alleged tax evasion and hawala dealings. The ED had earlier arrested Shivakumar in September 2019.

378.title: Fortunately, Shiva Trilogy isn't being adapted into a movie: Author Amish
378.article_body: Author Amish Tripathi said "fortunately" his Shiva Trilogy is not being adapted into a movie, and instead being adapted into a series. "It has to be edited [if adapted into a movie]. That's a reality...You have the gift of time in [a] series," he added. "I am not too worried just because it's being adapted into a series," stated Amish.

379.title: WB minister Partha Chatterjee questioned by CBI for over 8 hrs in SSC case
379.article_body: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee was questioned for more than eight hours by the CBI in the alleged SSC recruitment irregularities on Wednesday. Chatterjee was questioned in three shifts at the CBI office in Kolkata, an official said. This was the second time since May 18 that the minister was questioned by the probe agency in connection with the case.

380.title: 19-yr-old youth hangs self in Zirakpur, female friend booked for abetment
380.article_body: A 19-year-old youth hanged himself from a ceiling fan at his house in Punjab's Zirakpur following which his female friend has been booked for abetment to suicide. Both of them studied at a private university in Kharar, an official said. The youth wanted to marry her but she had started seeing someone else, his father said in his complaint.

381.title: Canadian police ban PM Trudeau from event over safety concerns
381.article_body: Canadian police on Wednesday said they'd barred PM Justin Trudeau from a fundraising event over safety concerns after protesters started gathering outside the venue. Talking about the incident, Trudeau said attendees faced harassment, racist insults, and threats of violence. One of the protesters reportedly carried a model gallows and noose adorned with a slogan accusing Trudeau of treason.

382.title: Congress and NCP are our real enemies, not BJP: Sena's Vikas Gogawale
382.article_body: Shiv Sena (youth wing) leader Vikas Gogawale said that the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and Congress are the real enemies of the Sena and not the BJP. NCP and Congress take credit for the works done by Shiv Sena workers, he alleged. "Four former Congress corporators and a Shiv Sena corporator joined NCP last month," Gogawale further said.

383.title: I was nervous when defending 35 off 18: Harshal after win vs LSG
383.article_body: Talking about bowling the 18th over against LSG, RCB pacer Harshal Patel said he was nervous after LSG got six runs off two wides and needed 35 to win off 18 balls. "I realised the wide yorker wasn't coming through...[so], I followed the plan that worked in first two overs," he added. LSG scored two more runs in the over.

384.title: MP Police arrests 6 for damaging Jawaharlal Nehru's statue in Satna
384.article_body: Police arrested six people on Wednesday for their alleged involvement in damaging the statue of former Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru in Madhya Pradesh's Satna. A video of the alleged incident that went viral on social media showed some youths damaging the statue. Condemning the incident, former Chief Minister Kamal Nath tweeted, "I demand from the government to investigate the case."

385.title: Plane designed as flying museum in tribute to Maradona unveiled, pics surface
385.article_body: A plane designed as a flying museum in tribute to late football legend Diego Maradona was unveiled in Argentina's Buenos Aires on Wednesday. The Tango D10S, a 12-seater plane, has been financed by Argentine fintech company Give and Get. The plane will fly around Argentina and eventually to Qatar for the FIFA World Cup in November.

386.title: Why are you in politics, go home & cook: BJP leader to Supriya Sule; her husband reacts
386.article_body: Maharashtra BJP President Chandrakant Patil on Wednesday criticised NCP's Supriya Sule, saying, "Why are you even in politics, just go home and cook." Reacting to it, her husband Sadanand Sule said BJP is misogynistic, and added, "I'm proud of my wife who is a homemaker, mother and a successful politician, one amongst many other hardworking and talented women in India."

387.title: Daughter of teacher killed in US school attack posts tribute for her mother
387.article_body: The daughter of Eva Mireles, a teacher who was killed in mass shooting at a school in US' Texas, has posted tribute for her mother. "My sweet mommy, I'll miss you forever," Adalynn Ruiz wrote, addressing her mother as "the half that makes me whole". She called Mireles a "hero" who jumped in front of students to save them.

388.title: Can't think of more unlikely combination: Raghavan on Katrina, Sethupathi
388.article_body: Discussing his upcoming film 'Merry Christmas' which stars Katrina Kaif and Vijay Sethupathi, director Sriram Raghavan said, "I can't think of a more unlikely screen combination than this." Vijay stated Katrina is professional and very committed to her part. "It's lovely to work with her...Audiences will love the combination," he said. Vijay will be next seen in Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram'.

389.title: This is very concerning: Musk on Twitter allegedly misusing user data
389.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in response to Twitter paying $150 million in the US to settle claims of misusing user data, said, "If Twitter was not truthful here, what else is not true? This is very concerning news." Twitter allegedly used private data to target advertising for over six years after telling users it would be used for security reasons.

390.title: 78% school students found online learning during pandemic 'burdensome': Survey
390.article_body: According to a survey conducted by the Ministry of Education, at least 78% school students found online learning during the pandemic "burdensome" and 24% of them did not have a digital device at home. The survey was conducted last year in November across India for classes 3, 5, 8 and 10 in which about 34 lakh students participated.

391.title: Won't cede control of Russia-occupied areas: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
391.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy dismissed suggestions that Ukraine should cede control of some areas occupied by Russian forces to reach a peace deal. Former US State Secretary Henry Kissinger this week had suggested Ukraine should let Russia keep Crimea, which it annexed in 2014. Reacting to it, Zelenskyy accused Kissinger of being like those who appeased the Nazis in 1938.

392.title: 2 BESCOM workers die, 1 seriously injured due to electric shock in K'taka
392.article_body: Two contract workers of Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Ltd (BESCOM) died and one was seriously injured after suffering an electric shock in Karnataka's Chintamani rural division on Wednesday. "Three workers were stringing an 11 kV cable line by replacing...old one...The cable accidentally came in contact with 66 kV line and caused a fatal accident," a senior BESCOM official said.

393.title: Kajol, Rani Mukerji & Ananya Panday attend Karan's 50th b'day; pics surface
393.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar turned a year older on May 25 as he celebrated his 50th birthday. His grand birthday party took place last evening in Mumbai and the theme was "black and bling". Several celebrities including Kajol Devgan, Rani Mukerji, Ananya Panday, Janhvi Kapoor, Sidharth Malhotra, Kiara Advani, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Abhishek Bachchan among others attended the party.

394.title: 3 Sudanese nationals arrested with US dollars worth ₹12 cr in Mumbai
394.article_body: The Air Intelligence Unit (AIU) of Customs seized US dollars worth ₹12 crore from three Sudanese nationals in Mumbai, an official said on Wednesday. In the first case, two Sudanese passengers were arrested at the airport on Tuesday with US dollars worth around ₹5.6 crore. Whereas, a stash of US currency was seized from another Sudanese national in South Mumbai.

395.title: Russian hackers linked to new Brexit leak website: Google
395.article_body: Google has said that the 'English Coop' website which has published leaked emails from several leading supporters of Britain's exit from the EU is tied to Russian hackers. Richard Dearlove, who led Britain's MI6 between 1999-2004, confirmed being targeted by the hackers and said the leaked material should be treated with caution. Pro-Brexit historian Robert Tombs has also been targeted.

396.title: Out of 76, only 7 Marathwada towns in Maharashtra get water daily: Report
396.article_body: Out of 76 urban centres across eight districts in Maharashtra's Marathwada region, only seven receive water supply daily, according to a report by Aurangabad divisional commissioner's office. As per the report, the gap between two water supplies ranges from one to 15 days. The Jalna district's Badnapur town suffers the most as it receives water supply once in 15 days.

397.title: Akhilesh asks Maurya 'You take father's money to build roads?', UP CM says 'not right'
397.article_body: After Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya said it seems development in Uttar Pradesh has been done by selling Akhilesh Yadav's land in Saifai, the Samajwadi Party chief asked Maurya if he takes money from his father to build roads. Meanwhile, state Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said it wasn't right for Yadav to use indecent words for Maurya.

398.title: Telangana CM to be not present in Hyderabad during PM Modi's visit
398.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao will not be present in Hyderabad during PM Narendra Modi's visit to the city on Thursday. KCR is scheduled to be in Bengaluru to meet former Prime Minister and Janata Dal (Secular) leader HD Devegowda. PM Modi is visiting Hyderabad to participate in the 20th-anniversary celebrations of the Indian School of Business.

399.title: Don't exempt defence services from RTI, veterans' body urges PM
399.article_body: The Indian Ex-Services League, an organisation of military veterans, has written a letter to PM Narendra Modi asking him not to let defence services be exempted from the purview of Right to Information (RTI) Act. Retired Brigadier Kartar Singh said RTI is a powerful tool for veterans, serving officers and their families to get service-related information and seek redressal.

400.title: 3 men cheat Odisha resident of ₹42 lakh on promise of doubling investment
400.article_body: Three men were arrested for cheating a resident of Odisha of ₹42.32 lakh on the promise of doubling his investment in 66 days. The complainant said accused persons told him that they are based in Chandigarh. The complainant transferred a total amount of ₹42.32 lakh in multiple transactions between August 2020 and February 2021.

401.title: NIA takes over investigation in Karnal IED seizure case
401.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has taken over the investigation in the case pertaining to seizure of explosives in Haryana's Karnal on May 5. Notably, four terror suspects were arrested with three IEDs, 31 live cartridges and ₹1.3 lakh cash. The accused were reportedly in touch with a Pakistan-based man who asked them to deliver the explosives to Telangana.
